Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: fergipoo
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel for me and my husband. We went to Rome on a short notice 4 day vacation. We used points for this hotel and rally didn't know where it was. However it's very close o the airport.....lot so much to the city center though.nwhen we got to the hotel we realized we'd have to take the shuttle into the city center everyday. At 20euro round trip for 2 people, it can get pricey quickly. But the shuttle oes drop you right by Castel San Angelo, just about 6 minutes walk to the Vatican, and minutes from all the other main attractions other than the Coloseum. The hotel room was great, it was off season so the pool was closed. Eat in the city, the hotel is pricey and not many options. Do your research before you go, the concierge is ok but doesn't always have the information you need. Nice to come back and relax in a big hotel room, rather than small one in the city. Would recommend, look forward to going back to Rome soon.

Reviews.Title: “A prison for tourists ? Huge faceless conference hotel miles from anywhere”
Reviews.Author: LouiseKennedy
Reviews.Content: I was here on a conference so I wasnt paying the bill - but if I was I would have been dreadfully disappointed if I thought I was coming to Rome. From the outside it looks like a prison - high security fencing reminds you that this is not a great area - but its a Marriott so it must be good mustn't it?? Well not really. However the bedrooms are very good - the marriot trademark beds are wonderfully comfortable and a strange bathroom arrangement - one room with bath and basin, other with shower loo and basin, actually works well when two people are trying to get ready at the same time. Bar drinks very expensive as you would expect, but normally you have the option of going elsewhere, however here you are completely captive - there is nothing to walk to at all and if you want to go to the 'nearest' restaurant you still need to get cabs (but it is excellent and a fraction of eating at the hotel so well worth it) or its a 40 minute taxi ride into the city. If you are on business then the decision has probably already been made for you, and as a conference hotel it does what it has to - its huge and impersonal and expensive. But if you are an independant traveller and want to see Rome then stay in Rome - this is not a tourist hotel. The weather was lovely while we were there but there was nowhere to sit out - the lovely gardens around the pool were gated and locked despite it being 30 degrees, so apart from a small number of chairs outside the bar area the only other option was to pay to go into the spa from which you have access to a very small garden area with sun chairs and trees - but for someone wanting an hour in the fresh air between meetings there is nothing at all - its quite incredible. This hotel is firmly bottom of my list of hotels I would choose to return to. Having stayed in approximately 40 hotels in the last 12 months of variing qualities its quite something to say there is nothing whatsoever to warrent staying here when there are so many other options available.

Reviews.Title: “Odd Location, Great Ambiance”
Reviews.Author: aliavoyage11
Reviews.Content: While located in a bit of weird place (looks like an industrial park, complete with gated entrance), the Marriott Park hotel offers very comfortable, large rooms and excellent food and service. Positives: - Beautiful lobby (soaring trompe l'oeil ceilings, plush chairs) - Great food options (I'm vegan and I found plenty to satisfy me, though would have loved to see oatmeal at breakfast) - Large rooms with comfortable beds and spacious bathrooms Negatives: - Odd location, difficult to get to - Internet service is slow; I had to buy an upgrade to get a decent connection - The layout in the bathroom is odd - no place to hang hand towels except over the bath tub, and the shower is odd. The glass door opens out, which means that any towel you put down gets pushed across the room - so you step out with wet feet and then things get slippery...

Reviews.Title: “Wish my stay had been longer ...”
Reviews.Author: NCWorldTraveler704
Reviews.Content: I recently completed a very quick 2-night stay at the Rome Marriott Park Hotel where I was speaking at a large conference. The hotel is simply massive, with a very impressive lobby -- soaring ceilings, a restaurant and large bar area and dozens of red sofas for relaxing -- and, sadly, the ONLY WiFi option in the entire hotel. My room was huge! King size bed with a half-dozen assorted pillows -- a marble bathroom with a great shower AND a large, deep soaking tub. It also had the largest balcony I've ever had, overlooking the pool and palm trees. The Marriott also had one of the very best gyms I've found. I really do wish my stay had been longer -- and the ONLY reason I've given the hotel 4 instead of 5 points is because of the lack of wifi in the guest rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Park Hotel Rome, goos business choice”
Reviews.Author: Anat100
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close by the airport, nice rooms vey clean, the staff is very kind and professional? I spent a week in the hotel, no complains but if you are in Rome better think of hotel in the city

Reviews.Title: “Strangle but Comfortable Rooms in the Middle of No-where”
Reviews.Author: FromToronto2011
Reviews.Content: My room had two bathrooms. One with a shower and one with a tub. Each with toilet, bidet and sink. Silly use of space Great kingside bed. Meeting rooms were great and food good. Morning breakfast included in rate was good too. Windows open and good temperature control. Sole issue is the 40 euro taxi cab rides each way to Rome. Not recommended for leisure stay but excellent for business meetings. The bar lacks life in the middle of the airport like hanger they call reception/hotel lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for conference and Business”
Reviews.Author: SilvioEberardo
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel for conference and business events. It is also a nice place to rest in the weekend after or before your visit to the center of the city of Rome. The rooms are very nice, for a reasonable price and the entire hotel has the world famous Marriott quality. It is also very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Roma”
Reviews.Author: GrammyZ5735
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the perfect place to unwind after a long day of sightseeing. It's 11 km from the International Airport and approximately 15 km from Rome. Our family met there for a mini vacation, then on to Crete. The hotel was clean and spacious, the pool was amazing and the countryside was beautiful. The breakfast we experienced was outstanding. The staff was very helpful. This was the perfect spot without the hustle and bustle of the city and the tourists. Enjoy the beauty and flavor of Roma!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, terrible location”
Reviews.Author: ProducerRich
Reviews.Content: I was working on a conference here for a week! This hotel is nice but in a terrible location - its mile away from anywhere! Rooms were nice, additional charge for the pool which wasn't great anyway and quite cold. The most surprising was there was only a selection of 4 main courses in the restaurant and 3 bar meals so I struggled to eat there all week and its not near anywhere else to eat!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed due to inability to get connecting flights the same day.”
Reviews.Author: traveloften13
Reviews.Content: It was necessary (due to my flights) to stay near the airport both outbound and returning. In both cases I stayed at this hotel (as a previous stay in another hotel closer to the airport made me realize that another Marriott alternative was needed). This hotel was a good choice and should I have this type of flight connections again will definitely stay here. The staff was friendly. The executive lounge has a very limited selection of food but what I had was good. (I did not have an opportunity to use the restaurant or spa, so I cannot comment.) If you plan to stay here (for the same reason as I did) and are planning to use the shuttle service used by this hotel, check your times with the shuttle schedule (on the hotel's website) as there are 3 hours (12PM til 3PM) they are not running (at least from the airport to the hotel). Unfortunately, my arrival on the return was shortly after 12PM so I stayed at the airport for over 2 hours waiting for the shuttle (but that was my decision and not a good one). As my flights out of Rome were in the AM, there was no issue.

Reviews.Title: “Rome business weekend”
Reviews.Author: transponding
Reviews.Content: After spending the prior week in Frankfurt on business, Rome was a welcomed change of venue. The food at this Marriott is far nicer than normal hotel fare. Being a Platinum, I was upgraded into a suite on the first floor with a magnificant balcony overlooking the surrounding countryside and pool area. Lovely room with a Las Vegas style marble bathroom. The hotel is situated about half way between the airport and downtown Rome. But not to worry. There are very comfortable transport buses that run on the hour, and drop you off at the north end of the Umberto bridge, about 5 city blocks north of the Piazza Novona (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Piazza_Navona) and about a kilometer east of St Peter's. The buses run on the half-hour to return. I did not bring my Italian power converter but the hotel business center provided me one, at no charge, for the duration of my stay. I returned it at check out. Really lovely service and clean, immaculate room.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and Comfort at its best”
Reviews.Author: pg003
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel with exceptional service. Taxi to central Rome can vary from 45 to 75 Euros depending on time of day, rush hour is not the best time to travel. The hotel is situated on a hill with a substantial view. The interior is very clean and well kept with amazing artwork on the ceilings. If you are looking for a business trip then this is ideal as it is only 40 to 50 euros from Rome airport by taxi and outside of Rome so isnt much of a touristy type hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good for conferences”
Reviews.Author: KarinGlobal
Reviews.Content: This hotel is also a conference centre and hence it is a massive hotel on the outskirts of Rome. It is not a choice for visiting the centre of Rome. I was very impressed how the hotel was run. Very efficiently for meal times, as well as a good service at the reception, concierge and the bar. My room was spacious and well furnished with a comfortable bed and sound proof. The bathroom was also nicely equipped and worked well. The hotel had also a nice outdoor pool area that I didn't try, but looked nice. If you are staying for a conference, I would recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “very nice if not a little expensive”
Reviews.Author: stevehayabusaman
Reviews.Content: nice hotel but very expensive and theres nothing at all close by ,the hotel provides a coach service to the centre of rome at a price of E10.00

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms away from the city sites”
Reviews.Author: CIdaho
Reviews.Content: Stayed as part of a small group. Breakfast was buffet with lots of variety. Service was friendly and responsive.They even had a sack breakfast for our very early departure.. Room was nice. Transportation to city sites and tours was a part of our group but would have been a problem if on our own without transportation. Internet available if you are willing to pay the price.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Stay on the Outskirts of Rome”
Reviews.Author: guvnor1001
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a 3 day conference at the Marriott Park hotel in Rome. Firstly the plus point(s) :- * The hotel rooms are a good size and are well appointed * Decent conference facilities * Convenient for On the negative side :- * The location is a long way from central Rome. There are no viable public transport options to get in to Rome so your only choice is the hotel bus that goes in to the centre periodically. I love Rome but being close to the conference was more important for me on this trip * The hotel restaurant was DREADFUL. In Italy I love the relaxed service and great food. Unfortunately this hotel restaurant specialised in terrible service and abysmal food. The pasta was ok but it would take in excess of an hour to get a plate of it. On the evening they ran out of chicken (...?) I opted for the scallops. The scallops turned up an hour after the pasta and were grey and rubbery on a bed of mushy over-wilted greens. I attempted to eat them but gave up for fear of food poisoning and didn't have the will to wait another hour for a replacement so I gave up and had them removed from the bill. The lack of a viable restaurant at the hotel is a major issue because there is nowhere close offsite to eat at *) My room was at the end of the corridor in the wing accessed from the 'A' elevators. These rooms overlook the highway and are therefore quite noisy which is an issue if the A/C is turned off (fairly typical at this time of year) and you want the window open to keep the room cool

Reviews.Title: “Too far away from Rome and only vaguely adequate...”
Reviews.Author: Bob1e
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights, it's seriously far out of central Rome. They believe they have great customer service. They don't. Firstly, some good, there is a spectacular view from the back of the hotel. The breakfast is really quite good and the staff there are excellent. The front desk staff are poor, making assumptions about what the guests want, then failing to appropriately apologise and attempting to shift blame to a third party booking agency. It seemed everything was too much trouble. Their in-room safes are confusing and they are patronising about performing education regarding them (I have never had a problem understanding a safe in any locality around the world before). WiFi costs, which seems to be common in the hotels which seem to regard themselves as high class. And for the second time (See my Castle Dargan review) there was an intent to charge us for spa facilities in the hotel in which we were resident. Unbelievable! They had the gall to say, but you can use the gym free of extra charge, but not the indoor pool or spa facilities.This is profiteering of the lowest kind in my opinion. I do not recommend this hotel to anyone, however the breakfast and the fact that they found my swimming goggles (Which I left in my room) rescue them from a one star review.

Reviews.Title: “Dissappointing”
Reviews.Author: sekret_skwirrel
Reviews.Content: Two main problems 1.The buffet lunch costing 35 euro was abysmal. There was a selection of a few bowls of tepid pasta, some limp salads and a few sweet tarts to choose from. Very disappointing for the price. 2. The room was noisy. This was due to a combination of the double glazed windows not closing properly, a large air conditioning unit outside the room and the proximity of the hotel to the airport. There also seemed to be a lot of noise from the service area on the ground floor - including something that seemed to be sliding or rolling on a track making a sound like a jet engine. Other issues 1. The hotel is not close to the center - it took over an hour to get to the center on the shuttle bus from the hotel (10 euro return). Not a problem for me as I was attending a conference at the hotel. 2. No shower curtain in the bathroom 3. No tea/coffee making facilities - is this just an Italian thing? Other than this the room was clean and the decor very swanky - all marble and gold.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel to use points if you arrive late into Rome.”
Reviews.Author: days32110
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because there weren't many Marriott options and since we arrived late into Rome (8pm) we didn't worry about getting into the city that evening. The hotel has a shuttle from the airport but it does cost money. Turn right out of baggage claim and keep walking...just keep asking for the Marriott shuttle and everyone will direct you - we didn't have a problem finding it. We took the second shuttle into town the next day and didn't have any problems getting a seat on the bus. The bus does drop you off in an obscure location so you'll need to walk a good distance or take a cab. We just took a cab to the hotel we were staying in for the rest of our time in Rome. The hotel should really consider a drop off location near a metro stop - that would be much more convenient. My only other recommendation would be to not get room 5001. While this room doesn't have a room above it there is a kitchen on that floor and if there is a banquet that evening (like we experienced) then you'll hear noises above like someone is bowling up there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but not so great location”
Reviews.Author: Christian C
Reviews.Content: If it would not be for the location I would have given the hotel 5 stars. Great hotel, up to date and very comfortable rooms - similar to rooms you would be getting at a JW Marriott. The staff was friendly from bell staff to front desk and concierge. We did not dine nor have room service therefore I really can’t comment on the food service. The location is far outside from the center of Rome. They do however have a bus shuttle to the center that we utilized at a not too expensive rate. In summary: If you don’t mind the location its a great hotel with great staff. If location is a big factor for you stay away from here and go closer to the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, but bad location”
Reviews.Author: flyboy55
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rome Marriott Park Hotel for one night before leaving Italy. It's located in a semi-industrial area and is not very close to Rome. Upon arrival, there were several people checking in and checking out. There was only two desk agents working and the lines were moving incredibly slow. After waiting in line for about 20 minutes, one desk agent started yelling at the lines saying "check-out only". Everyone waiting to check-in had to stand and wait. Everyone waiting to check-in was very upset. After standing for about 45 minutes, I was finally at the desk checking-in. I expressed my displeasure with the disorganized waiting process and the agent simply said "sorry". As a very loyal Marriott customer, this was the worst check-in experience I have ever had. The room was surprisingly very nice and extremely comfortable. There was 2 bathrooms, one with a shower/toilet/bidet/sink and the second had a bathtub/sink. Very nice finishings in both. The internet is a rip-off at 22 euro/24 hrs. The fitness center in the hotel is huge and extremely well equipped with cardio equipment and free weights and lots of weight machines. The breakfast buffet is fantastic. A very large selection of fruit, hot food and cold food. And waffles and omelets made to order. Upon check-out, the hotel had made a mistake with the payment. The desk agent said there was nothing that could be done and all charges would have to go to my credit card. She was not helpful and this was a very unpleasant last experience before leaving the hotel. The service definitely is in need of improvement at this Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “you go there for a meeting not a vacation”
Reviews.Author: Caligirl1976
Reviews.Content: Typical Marriott style - rooms were nice and the bedding was great! BUT, it is very far from the center of Rome and you have to either take an expensive taxi or use their shuttle bus. The bus is cheap enough (10 euro round trip) but leaves only every 2 hours and picks up every 2 hours. Not the best solution but do-able. I was there for a meeting and would not have been able to see the city even if we were closer to the sights. The hotel itself is nicely decorated and very big, clean and spacious. Do not choose this place if you are vacationing.

Reviews.Title: “Fine and magnificent, far from city centre but close to Fiumicino.”
Reviews.Author: JORGEUruguay
Reviews.Content: You can stay at this Marriott as it waas your home. Probably with the largest and practical lobby I´ve ever seen (all services around, an excellent lobby bar), the rooms are refined and comfortable. I´ve stayed for a business meeting and the infrastructure is perfect with several all-size rooms . Meals and services are of very good quality. The spa offers multiple options to relax or work out, with a complete fitness room and indoor & outdoor pools. As you will see in many hotels in Rome, there´s no wireless connection in the room (not even paying for it!) but very good high speed internet. If you plan to visit Rome city centre, there´s a shuttle that leaves you and picks you up close to Piazza Navona every 2 hours, and you are charged 10 euros for the round trip, and it takes around one hour tio get there, it´s a bit far and not very practical if you want to maximize your stay in Rome. All in all, an excellent hotel, a bit far from the core touristic attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LItraveller
Reviews.Content: Hotal is only 4 years old, very beautiful with all the art work, ornate wood furniture and huge lobby with restaurant and bar. They also do a lot of corporate meetings there as there are a number of meeting rooms. Pool was closed for the season when we got there (10/5/11) but looked beautiful. We're not Spa people but for those who are it looked very nice. Room had 2 bathrooms (one with shower/bidt/toilet/sink and the other with tub/sink) which was very welcome after spending 7 days in typical European-style bathrooms. Room was very clean and had many English-speaking channels on the TV, so we could keep up with recent events a little better, including sports! Plenaty of elevators that wer large enough to fit you and your luggage as well. Staff is very friendly and the shuttle to/from the airport is reight there and reasonably priced. Only things I'd caution you about is the price of the breakfasts are very high (continental breakfast is something like 16 Euros, and the buffet is something like 28 Euros). So you'll need to consider alternatives if that's too pricey for you. Also realize that to get to Rome you'll need to take a bus to/from. We didn't do this since we only had to spend the night on our way back home and had already been to Rome, but the hotel is about 1/2 way between the airport and Rome, so take that into consideration. It's a good hotel to start your Italian visit with, though, as it "eases you into" the Italian lifestyle better than going right into an Italian hotel with some of the eccentricies associated with that type of hotel. I reccomend it!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, awesome breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Sera D
Reviews.Content: This hotel was everything you would expect for a luxury hotel. Rooms were luxurious, clean and functional and the breakfast was superb. The only disappointment was that we had to pay for WIFI and was a good 20-30 minute shuttle bus ride away from the heart of Rome. Other than that, highly recommend and really enjoyed our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location far from noisy Central Rome”
Reviews.Author: Culfoxio
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from a short visit to Rome with my cousin where we stayed at the Rome Marriott Park. The hotel is located about a 25 minute ride (with light traffic) to central Rome. There is a hotel shuttle bus that takes you to the Castel Sant'Angelo area and drops you off right in from of the Corte di Cassazione building where you will see other hotel and shuttle buses. The charge is €10 round trip - a great deal in this expensive city. I forgot to mention that there is also an airport shuttle that charges €20 for the ride from the Fiumicino to the hotel but since the pick up schedule said there was a 3-hour gap from noon to 3pm when the shuttle is not operating - and this is when we had just landed, we decided not to wait that long and just took a taxi instead. The taxi cost was a total of €35 for that same short ride. The hotel is located out in the quiet suburbs right next to a modern apartment complex on a hill -- the views are pretty decent and you definitely feel that you are away from the hustle and bustle of the city. The hotel has lots of conventions happening all year round. The rooms were pretty impressive -- very clean, classic decor, there were 2 bathrooms in our room -- kind of odd, but one had the toilet and bidet along with a shower and sink, and the other had a large bathtub and a sink. Both bathrooms have towel warmers -- such an awesome treat! I didn't care much for my door lock though, as I had to really slam the door in order for it to lock. I would however highly recommend this hotel if you don't mind the fact that it's definitely not within walking distance to all the history that The Eternal City has to offer its many visitors.

Reviews.Title: “No in-room wifi = disqualifier”
Reviews.Author: Teters-NL
Reviews.Content: I have spend one night in this hotel, which is situated in a kind of office park area on a hill with (in my case) a view on the highways around it. First impression at the inside is that it is huge! I stayed in the A-wing at the end of the corridor. From there it took me a serious five minute walk to get to the breakfast area. Rooms are very nice and clean and quite spacey as well. They feel very comfortable. The bed is excellent, I haven't had a better hotel bed than here. Unlike others I did not have any bad experience with the airport taxi (EUR 35) from Fiumicino, which was confirmed at the reception as normal. The shuttle to the city center took quite a while for EUR 10, the taxi back to the hotel took EUR 35 again, which was predicted in the hotel. Very nice staff, nice breakfast area and well sorted. I enjoyed it very much. Still in times of upcoming iPads and other mobile computer devices wifi in the room for me is a must. This is the only disqualifier for me regarding this hotel.

Reviews.Title: ““MARRIOTT PARK HOTEL ROME - GREAT PLACE””
Reviews.Author: anna0207
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 night in the Marriott Park Hotel in Rome .we had two rooms. one normal one exclusive. Great rooms! great staffs for the pool bar. thank you. This was a wonderful time. Great hotel :)

Reviews.Title: “MARRIOTT PARK HOTEL ROME - GREAT PLACE”
Reviews.Author: JERSEYBK
Reviews.Content: We spent one night in the Marriott Park Hotel in Rome after returning from a cruise. Great hotel, new and very modern. Nice buffets for breakfast and dinner. Location is not as convienent as Mariott Grand Flora, however rooms are huge and cost is much less. They have a shuttle that goes to downtown Rome - leaves every 2 hours and costs 10.00 or 14.00 euro roundtrip (cannot remember which) - approx $ 14.00 US. Shuttle takes approx 25 minutes to get downtown - very convenient and comfortable.I would highly recommend this hotel to anybody not wanting to spend the price to stay downtown. There's nothing to do near the hotel however they have a great pool. Overall a geat hotel if you're willing to spend some extra time on the shuttle bus.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced underperformer”
Reviews.Author: Mark L
Reviews.Content: The only reason to stay here is for convenience if you are attending a conference. The hotel is in the middle of nowhere, near to nothing useful. It is hopeless for transport links to Rome centre. The rooms are OK I suppose, but the prices charged for any and all services are extortionate. To get a hamburger on room service €22; a single beer at the bar €8; a meal at the indifferent buffet €35; WiFi connection for a day so many Euros that I didn't bother. The food served at the conference (part of the prepaid package) was awful. They ran out on the first day before half the delegates had eaten. The lunches were vile - plain pasta without any sauce, garnish or taste; pizza that tasted like cardboard. A chef would need to be lacking all self respect to serve this for human consumption. Breakfast was so bad I stopped going after the first day - main feature was numerous staff dressed as waiters standing around doing nothing while diners searched the room for cutlery. The hotel has a pool, but they close and lock it about 6pm just when you might want to use it. This hotel really disgraces the brand of Marriott and I will avoid that chain in future for quite some time.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Marriott Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: Andreas K
Reviews.Content: I attended a congress with acouple of thousand delegates at this hotel and have never seen such incompetent staff. The room was nice and clean but do not get me started on the ridiciolous prices for drinks (Espresso 3€, small Coke 5€) or an internet connection (7€/h). The food was an catastrophy, worst pasta ever, the ceasar salad had no dressing, the maids did not remove dirty glases, the minibar was not stocked up and so on. Oh yes and this hotel is in the middle of nowhere, you can not reach anything by foot.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and great service”
Reviews.Author: maryannfm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rome Marriott Park Hotel for two nights and had a great experience there. The rooms are spacious and the beds very comfortable. We took the shuttle bus for 10E into the city and it was convenient. Staff were helpful. Beautiful pool. The restaurant looked nice but we did not eat there. I'm usually satisfied with Marriott but this hotel is exceptional! TIP: At the airport when you get outside walk to the right and you will see the shuttle bus area for the shuttle to the Marriott. Don't use the shuttle bus counter in the airport as they will charge twice as much for the ride (40E) and a taxi wanted 50E for the brief 10 minute ride. I found the shuttle and it cost 10E each that we paid at the hotel- a much better deal. I used the internet in the business center for 5E for 30min and it was efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Hotel Near Rome (FCO) Airport”
Reviews.Author: Jim K
Reviews.Content: To be closer to the Rome airport, my family of 5 stayed at the Marriot Park Hotel on the last night of our Italian vacation. This was one of the most impressive hotels we have ever seen, and by far the nicest we stayed at while in Italy. The location isn't ideal for visiting Rome city center, but the accomodations definitely help make up for this feature.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value even if you have to wait for the shuttle”
Reviews.Author: retiredtravelagent
Reviews.Content: Beds , room , facilities . All superb. Yes its away from it all . But to go back to a real North American room worth its weight in Gold to many. On the way back made the awful mistake of staying at the Hilton at the Airport.

Reviews.Title: “What a waste of time and money”
Reviews.Author: azita a
Reviews.Content: This hotel is too far from center of Rome. To our surprise we were told they can not offer us the rate they had confirmed our reservation for. If you plan to stay here , and I am not sure why any one would want to , be prepared to pay for Hotel bus that runs only every hour or pay extra for cab to take you to all there is to see in Rome. You also need to pay for breakfast and internet access which was very high. The staff was very unfriendly with only one or two at front desk the line to check in/ out was too long . We stayed in this hotel prior to our cruise and we had reservations to return after the cruise but we cancelled and instead made reservations in a small hotel near vatican and center of Rome that had the best saff and cleanest rooms. The line for concierge was also too long and we were able to get taxis at the hotel for much less than the amount they offered us on our own. Overall I do not recommend this hotel to any one since it was the worst experince and not worth the money if you are in Rome as a tourist and would rather do sight seeing than stay in lines at the hotel and wait for the bus or taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and Far Away”
Reviews.Author: cindykh
Reviews.Content: The Marriott web site reads "14km from city center. A reasonably priced shuttle … Conveniently located … ideal for … tourism in Rome." This is very misleading, as the hotel is in the middle of no where. There is a 30+ minute, 10 Euro per person, Marriott shuttle bus that drops at a not-so-convenient location in city center. The bus ran every 2 hours (not always on time) and is sometimes overbooked (not available at a convenient time). Thus, it is unrealistic to travel into Rome more than once a day. You are trapped far from the city center. There is no place to eat, except at the Marriott, where breakfast was about 24 Euros per person. Internet is an extra charge of about 24 Euros per day or 7,50 per hour. I was offered the "special deal" of breakfast for two and free internet in the Executive Lounge for about 70 Euro per day. We chose to be "unconnected" over being fleeced. The indoor pool had a 10 Euro per person cost. I did not see any of these fees disclosed on the website. The free outdoor pool closed at 8p when it got dark at 9:30p. I used points for this unpleasant experience. What a waste. It would have been a better to stay in town, or simply near any metro/train station, at almost any cost. Just add up the above fees for two people! We traveled for a month in Europe and stayed at many well-located, 3-star hotels that were more pleasant at a much lower cost, with Internet and breakfast included (free). The room wasn't much bigger, the shower didn't drain any better, and the staff was not helpful. The check-out line was longer than 10 minutes. The décor was ostentatious. The orange marble in the bathroom was overwhelming. The mini-bar is rigged so if you open the fridge and something falls out, you get charged a ridiculous fee if it not replaced in 15 seconds. We rode the public bus to the metro/train station and the trip into Rome was about an hour. And, given that you can "get off" at any city metro stop, it is probably shorter than the shuttle bus (because you can get off at your desired destination and do not have to walk / taxi). Certainly much cheaper. You can take the bus (about 10 minutes) to the commuter train at Muratella and get to the airport in 20 minutes. The bus/metro/train runs frequently (except on Sundays) and is not a bad experience – no matter how much the Marriott personnel try to talk you into the over-priced, inconvenient shuttles. Instead of the Marriott Rome stay being a pleasant "finale" for our European vacation, the lodging is a bad memory. I cannot emphasize enough the inconvenience of this location and the outrageous prices. As you plan a Rome vacation, remember that the public transportation is excellent. As long as you are near a metro stop, you can get to almost any tourist location quick and easy. We felt safe, even at night. Buy the Roma Pass which includes great museum deals and 3 days of public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Large and luxurious, great staff”
Reviews.Author: kpvin
Reviews.Content: The staff and concierge were extremely helpful, courteous, and patient. A surprise rail strike forced me to make alternative arrangements to meet with my college-age daughter for a very difficult connection timetable, but with their help it all worked out. The facility was immaculate and huge with a vey nice outdoor pool overlooking the area. The breakfast options ranged from 15 Euros for continental to an astounding 30 Euros for a full breakfast... we went the 'low' cost route and it was more than satisfactory. The room was quite large with very modern finishes in excellent condition. Although we had a car, we took advantage of the large parking lot [15 Euros/night] and made use of the free shuttle to the center of rome. Overall a good quality hotel, although its 30 minutes from the tourist areas, its not far from Fiumicino airport.

Reviews.Title: “A few reasons I would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: 227755d
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very modern, beautiful interior and spacious. Stayed four nights in early July on Marriott Reward Points. I like to be comfortable at hotels I stay at, and our room was a typical sized American hotel room with two bathrooms one with a bath and sink, the other with a shower, toilet and sink, king bed, flat screen, in room safe, furnishings were tastefully done. Our view was of the pool. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet every morning, a perk of being Marriott Gold and had access to in room internet. The staff at the hotel are not the most enthusiastic bunch, but if pressed will assist you. True the hotel is not close to downtown, it is approximately 45 mins away, but is easily accessed via bus, train,subway. I feel it was most efficient way to get around Rome, but you have to be prepared for commuting. If you want to step out of your hotel and be at the sites, don't stay here, but if you want to stay at a beautiful place with a pool and don't mind the commute you will enjoy it. The hotel also provides a shuttle service to the airport and downtown for a fee ,but check the schedule very carefully and make sure you understand the hours of operation. This hotel worked for us, we were happy with our experience there.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but pretty far away from the city”
Reviews.Author: desimd
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fine and the food in their restaurant was excellent. However, travel to and from the hotel to anywhere was a pain. We waited at the airport for the shuttle for quite a while before taking a cab. Didn't realize that the driver takes a two hour lunch break every day! There are regular shuttle rides to and from the city center, but you have to book early the previous day. If you don't and have a tight return schedule, count on a taxi that will be way too expensive (bad Euro/$ conversion these days). The rooms were excellent and roomier than downtown Rome where space is always an issue and rooms are small. But you pay the price by being away from the action. Nothing to do or see closeby either.

Reviews.Title: “So far from Rome”
Reviews.Author: christiebeach
Reviews.Content: If you have to stay here for business it is JUST bearable, but never pick this hotel if you want to sightsee. You are so far away from anything interesting (about 50 Euros in taxi). There is a way to take a taxi to the train and maybe that is faster and less expensive but we did not try it. I would not recommend this location if you are looking to stay in rome and eat or sightsee.

Reviews.Title: “We loved our accommodations, wonderful dining & staff & great pool.”
Reviews.Author: starrinc
Reviews.Content: We booked the Rome Marriott Park Hotel at the last minute. Our accommodations were outstanding. The staff was efficient, friendly and well-versed in English. The ENTIRE staff, from the front desk to the shuttle guys to the restaurant staff. The room was modern, clean, well-stocked and comfortable. The bedding was crisp and heavenly! The restaurant on the main level was bright and airy. They had an outstanding American buffet breakfast with made to order eggs and omelets, huge waffles and an assortment of sweets, rolls, meats, potatoes and fresh fruit and juices. The prices were low and the quality great. They had an espresso machine in the lobby 24/7 with teas as well. Between the outstanding breakfast and the espresso service we were well-prepared for a day of sight-seeing. The shuttle to the city was THE BEST. It was air-conditioned and comfortable and a great way to meet other people going into the city and to network a bit! The ride to the city was about :30 minutes and relaxing - it left on the evens and returned on the odd hours and was very inexpensive and clean and on-time. A fabulous value and a wonderful service. The pool was set up with an outstanding view, comfortable chaises and the main thing we looked forward to upon our return from a quite warm day of sight-seeing. A great way to recharge our bodies and then back on the shuttle for an evening of fun in Rome. We just loved our home base and I am so happy that we did not stay in the congested city or even in the Via Venata area as it was comforting to know that we were close enough to the airport should a last minute Italian strike occur....and the best part is that this Marriott offered a shuttle to the hotel from the airport and one to the airport as well. There was not one negative all pluses - we loved the hotel and fell in love with this outstanding staff, too!!!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive and far from Rome”
Reviews.Author: K2747
Reviews.Content: The hotel is VERY far outside Rome and the shuttle between the hotel and the city center is expensive. The room we stayed in was big, but when we got there nothing was as we were told it would be - no free wi-fi $50 for a roll away bed. The restaurant on site was (of course) over priced and not great. Breakfast was a good spread. The Executive Lounge was the best part of the hotel, with free food and drinks and a place to relax. The pool was also nice. The main redeeming quality about this hotel is proximity to the airport. If you want to see Rome, stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “It's alright for the price i paid”
Reviews.Author: ellabella1206
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Rome for 4 days before boarding a cruise leaving from Civitavecchia. For the most part we chose this hotel because we got it at an associate rate for pretty cheap. Would have loved to stay more in central Rome but could not afford that... So yes, just like everybody else says, it is far away from central Rome and the shuttle runs every 2 hours making you have to plan your day really well.. I would suggest to reserve the shuttle because 1 night we stayed roaming around Rome for 2 additional hours because there was no space on the shuttle bus.. The rooms are nice. Nothing much to say about that. The restaurant on site is expensive and not that good. And for the most part if you don't take the shuttle into Rome you are stuck eating expensive food that is just OKAY. The service is..not there.. nobody informed us how we had to turn on the lights and everytime i asked someone a question it seemed like we were bothering them.. Then again, for the price we paid we felt like we got out with a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but...”
Reviews.Author: TheVanNordens
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beautiful and our room was great. It is very far from ANYTHING and has one mediocre restaurant on site. It was absolutely dead during our 4 day stay.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for exploring Rome”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoILGal
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because I am able to obtain a friends and famly rate which made visitng Rome for three days affordable. Having said that, while I paid less, I couldn't imagine paying more than 100 Euro per night for this place. My room's bedding was fine as was the A/C and television, but the room's common areas were dusty (bedstand) as though the room hadn't been really cleaned well in some time. If you're a family of four, expect to have to get two rooms. They don't have rooms with two double beds that you can book. My husband's room was in the same condition. The fixtures in both bathrooms leaked and there were dirty caulking patch jobs around all of the bathroom fixtures. Believe it or not, however, the hotel's breakfast at 14 euros with kids eating free is really a bargain. The breakfast is large and varied and you'd pay more in the City of Rome, proper, if you should deiced to eat out. As an aside, about this hotel's location, whlie the hotel's website implies that they have a free bus to the downtown area, it's not free by any means, as is the case with evertying in Italy. Consider not taking the hotel bus for 3 Euro each way: instead, get a Rome 3 day transit pass or a combined pass for the busses/trains and sights for much less if you plan to stay in Rome few days. The transit pass gets you on the suburban commuter train which is just a block or so away from the hotel and the communiter train takes you to a transfer point in Rome with access to all of the sights. In all, the process takes about 30-40 mintues each way and isnt' that onerous. Like all commuiting it can be invonvenient and nothing it Italy is "on time." Finallly, when leaving Rome for the airport, don't be tempted to try to take public transportation to the airport. THe proceess takes hours and costs 15 Euro for the express train from downtown Rome. From this hotel it would be a ridiculous proposition to go into rome, and then pay to go back out. It would be three trains and two transfers with luggage. Perhaps if you are one person, don't care if you're on trains for three or more hours and and very cost conscious it would be a good decusion, but if you are two people traveling, buck up and pay the 55 Euros to the airport and use the hotel car service. we were glad we did.

Reviews.Title: “Rome Park Marriott - A Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vickie089
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Italy and had spent 8 nights at the Rome Park Marriott...7 first, then after 3 days in Venice we came back for one night before we left for the airport to return home. One of the nicest places we ever stayed. The hotel was beautiful, the pool area outstanding, the restaurant was good (service was a little slow, but food was good for the money) and the front desk staff couldn't have been nicer. Only problem is that it is a long way from downtown Rome. They did have an air-conditioned bus that took you near the Vatican and the cost was very reasonable and the service very reliable. We would recommend this hotel to anyone that is going to Rome. It is in a quiet area, very new and spotless with a wonderful staff!

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend if you want to sight see but also laze around a pool”
Reviews.Author: myviews30
Reviews.Content: We wanted to sight see but also spend some time relaxing in the sun by a pool. Very few hotels in Rome have outdoor pools so this is the main reason we picked this hotel. Good points Very clean, quiet and spacious hotel and rooms (ask for one looking over the pool) Lovely spa, gym and large swimming pool - open 9am - 8pm Pool mini restaurant open from 12 noon - ok but not much choice and quite pricey Regular reliable shuttle service on air conditioned coaches into and out of the city - going - on even hours coming back - on odd hours - 10 Euros per person per round trip - you must book a time Nice to leave the busy city after a day's sightseeing and come back to a quiet hotel Bad points Its about 30 mins on the coach to the city - but that didn't bother us There is nothing to walk to or look at outside the hotel - it is in the middle of nowhere Check in - slow No coffee/tea making facilities in room Didn't use the restaurant but 2 cocktails at the bar cost 28 Euros!!!! After breakfast we would sunbathe/swim until 12.30, then get the 2pm bus into the city. Sightsee (you do a LOT of walking) and return on either the 9pm or 11pm bus. (11pm is the last one!) We found this was the ideal way to spend a long weekend in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “"Good Hotel but far away from the City"”
Reviews.Author: skymir
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rome Marriott Park Hotel for 2 nights during the Easter weekend in April 2010 & found the hotel very comfortable.However the hotel is located at quite a distance from the main attractions in Rome.Would prefer to stay close to the city centre next time. There are coaches that leave from the hotel at convinient times that take you the city centre where you can do your sightseeing & return back to the hotel. Rooms are comfortable .

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel, but far from Rome city centre”
Reviews.Author: ozinamsterdam
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference at the hotel. It's a nice hotel, but really in the middle of nowhere. There's a shuttle service between the hotel and the centre of the city, but it is a hassle. The hotel was the usual high standard for Marriotts. Spacious and luxurious rooms by European standards, amazing bathrooms and generally helpful staff - although somewhat disorganised. It seemed quite expensive for a hotel that far outside of Rome though.

Reviews.Title: “Middle of No where”
Reviews.Author: judyb60
Reviews.Content: Hotel is dated and tired. They have only one restaurant and they serve the same menu for breakfast and dinner; bad and expensive. We are in Italy and they don't even have pizza on the menu! The hotel is approximately 45 minutes from the center of town and there is absolutely nothing nearby. We were advised not to walk outside as there are wild dogs. The internet in the room is very expensive-$22euro a day.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms!”
Reviews.Author: mespinar
Reviews.Content: Hotel is outside of Rome but their shuttle drops you right in the center of everything. No problem getting home when we chose either. The rooms were simply magnificent, I loved having a walkin shower and the bed was great.l We were jet lagged and definitely caught up on our sleep. I celebrated my birthday while staying here and had a lovely surprise cake in our room when we returned from sightseeing compliments of management.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: WPLandry
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights. We loved everything from the service to the food! The dining at the hotel restaurants is great! The service is excellent and the staff is very welcoming and helpful! The hotel is a bus ride away from the metro stations that will bring you throughout the ancient ruins and transportation to a from the hotel by bus was very easy and convenient. We would recommend this hotel to anyone and we would certainly return! We stayed in May 2009. TripAdvisor's date range does not go back that far.....

Reviews.Title: “Try another!”
Reviews.Author: Don938
Reviews.Content: This was the second stay for my wife and me. We thought the first experience was a fluke. It wasn't. The lobby is very poorly laid out with several steep steps right in front of the check in desk. They've added a short ramp to help with bags, but is too steep to walk on. People bringing bags down the ramp can easily lose control of their bag and have it fly into someone waiting with their back turned, at the check-in desk. The main restaurant was very expensive with the wine marked up several times, unlike Italy. When we left the next morning, there is no coffee service anywhere. They say it is coming later. It doesn't. Most of the staff were very nice with the exception of the bar where I encountered belligerence over questions about the wines on display. Something I've never experienced before in 20 trips to Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Place to Stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: nancycut
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. Wonderfully decorated and served great food. The only regrettable part was that it was quite a way from the center of Rome. You always had to take a shuttle bus and pay each time.

Reviews.Title: “VERY expensive”
Reviews.Author: THJ
Reviews.Content: Not really a bad Marriott - rooms are fine, reception had no major problems. My issue was the fact they seemed to be grasping for every $ you had. Parking works out at €12 per 24 hours. Breakfast is €27.50 per person. Use of the indoor pool is €10 per day. Internet is €22 per day. It's not a cheap hotel to start with considering its location. Once you add on these extras you can be easily adding €100 to your bill each day if you're a family. Exec lounge is available for €60 per day which includes breakfast which I suppose would make it a tad cheaper - but not much! My best tip if you have a car is to drive down the hill to the bottom (right, right, right) where there's a gorgeous bakery. We had breakfast there for €5. Easy enough to drive back up (left, left, left)!

Reviews.Title: “Refreshing comfort”
Reviews.Author: MissAtalanta
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights while in Rome and then actually came back for our last night in Italy to make it for a total of 3 nights. The place is great. The bed was the most comfortable we had in all of our 2 weeks in Italy. It was a refreshing place and spoiled us for the rest of our trip. The location is far from the city and at most time was about 45min with traffic to get into the center of Rome (where all the action is). However, they do have a convenient shuttle bus transportation that is only about 6 Euros pp which is much cheaper than a taxi ride. So for the beautiful view, luxurious comforts and amazing service it is worth the added commute away from the hustle and bustle. I didn't get to try out the Spa, but it looked amazing and might be worth trying it out next time. We were very well taken care of with our stay at Rome Marriott Park. The only negative for me was that they only had wi-fi if you were in the lobby area or down stairs in the lounge. No wi-fi in the room which is always a bummer. It also was at times pretty slow but being on vacation I shouldn't have worried much about the internet anyways right?

Reviews.Title: “Marriott doesn't care about details”
Reviews.Author: giaino
Reviews.Content: I was in Marriott Hotel for a convention. Everything was organized before we got there. Anyway we spent 1,5 hours at the checkin.... I wonder how a business 4 stars hotel can charge 7 euros per hour for internet access! I wonder why they let you use a pc to checkin your flight online but if you use a carrier like Alitalia that send you the boarding pass via mail, they don't let you check your email to print it. When I travel I love to be treated well and Marriott seems like an industry more than a hotel. ROOMS. They are fine, silent, clean, large enough. You have everything you need to sleep well. BREAKFAST, LUNCH AND DINNER. Poor, we ate same things every day we were there. POSITION. 10 minutes from Fiumicino airport, very good for business proposals. 30 min by taxi to center Rome RECEPTION. Terrible organization in my experience. WELLNESS. Good wellness and gym area. PARKING. 8 euros per day.

Reviews.Title: “Only good for meetings. Too far away”
Reviews.Author: nas421
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel in the middle of nowhere. It is had to really call it "Rome". Driving in I was concerned as the street leading to the hotel is lined with piles of trash and at 1AM stray dogs abound. Once on property however, things improved considerably. Rooms were nice and spacious by European standards. Service was good and the staff tried to be helpful. It is at least a 30Euro cab ride to the city center so be wary of that. Some of my colleagues reported being up charged by taxis for the drive to the hotel. I was attending a conference, which was well supported by the hotel. I also had meetings with collaborators from Italy. Not a great spot for this as it took >1hour for many to arrive from the local train station.

Reviews.Title: “location terrible...hotel o.k.”
Reviews.Author: telis
Reviews.Content: i stayed there for a conference/meeting otherwise there was not a chance to stay in this hotel which is located in the middle of nowhere and extremelly far from the city of rome. the hotel is very typical only for conferences and meetings and nothing more.the lobby and lounges are enormous and furnished in a very bad taste a mixture of classical and modern plus some ancient -egyptian- style statues and columns.it is one of the most kitch hotel lobbies i have ever seen. check in was quick and professional.my room on the 5th floor was very beautiful like i was in another hotel compare to the lobby.it was very tastefully furnished with baroque style furnishings a beautiful venetian style mirror, very comfortable beds and in general in extra good condition.the view was to the motorway. it had a flat screen tv and internet, mini bar automatic with the most resonable prices i have ever seen in a marriott hotel, and a bathroom split in ...two!there was a bathroom with a shower , a sink and w.c. and another next to it with a sink and a bathtub both very clean and new and added in the room the feeling of extra luxury. it was a shame that they did not provide bathrobes or sleepers. the food in the hotel was above average.the building outside very plain. the location is terrible it is 25-30 euros by taxi one way to the center of rome. there is a shuttle bus service from/to the hotel but the hours that they run it are not very convinient.if i stay there again?certainly not-i prefer more centrally located hotels otherwise it is in general a very good 4 star hotel with the exemption of the decoration in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “huge luxury and in the middle of nowhere at least 35 mins from Rome”
Reviews.Author: cheshirecat32
Reviews.Content: stayed at this enormous and very spacious hotel for business reasons and can think of no other reason why you would. 2hourly hotel run bus service in to Rome very good but offers little flexibility to pop in between sessions or for an odd hour - costs 6 euros single and 10 return A taxi costed us about 32 euros one way . Surrounded by new flats and industrial units - no local village etc. Hotel rooms very comfy and clean. My had 2 bathrooms - not quite sure why. Food on the buffets and breakfast nice hot and fresh but nothing special On the whole nice hotel if someone else is paying but a long way from the sites of Rome and anything else.

Reviews.Title: “Good conference centre”
Reviews.Author: more_jameson
Reviews.Content: I spend 4 days on the conference in this hotel. Nice, modern hotel with beutiful rooms, standard Marriott services. Bad location with necessary shuttle to city center, it took nearly one hour to get to city and 40 minutes to go back in the night.As usual in Marriot, you have to pay extra money for everything, thanks god not for breathing :-) but it is standard policy, not only in Rome. Staff was proffesional and friendly. There was a big event for one political party at the hotel during my stay, so all the bars were very busy and get one coffee took long time, but that is life :-) Could reccommend for travellers who used to stay in this chain hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lissette0708
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. Although there is really nothing around, the service is ok. You have to know that this is another country so American customs are not common so don't take it as an insult. You have to ask for ice. The great add is that they have drop off/pick up to Piattsa Fiore (sorry for spelling) which is great, very close to Vatican City. The inside of the hotel lobby is amazing - we had to wait like 3 hours to check in because we had an early flight from NYC to Rome and then the entire hotel was packed. We got the price at $99 a night so this was completely worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Like any other Marriott but not in the city of Rome”
Reviews.Author: MMmd
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel in terms of the rooms and facilities. The major reason for scoring this hotel down is the location. The hotel is in the region of but it is not in the city of Rome. The only reason for staying here is to attend a conference or bussiness meeting. If you want a hotel to explore Rome I suggest you look elsewhere. Internet access is over 25 euro per 24hours. Although the charge is shown as 22 euro when you agree online this does not include tax so you end up paying >25 euro.

Reviews.Title: “A Business/Conference Center, not for holiday travelers”
Reviews.Author: StuTheDog
Reviews.Content: We have to admit that as Marriott frequent stayer's we got our week at the Rome Park Hotel comp'd so it is probably not fair to complain but folks considering this hotel need to know that it is a business/conference center located in a business park outside Rome, e.g Alitalia's corporate headquarters is in the park. As such it attracts a lot of conventions and tradeshows and many of those attending are on expense accounts so cost is not an issue. The hotel property is beautiful, very grand and spacious, probably on par with a 4-5 star property in town. This is a high class property but not catering to tourists. As another reviewer mentioned the restaurant is way overpriced - the €36 buffet is totally not worth it. If you are a Marriott rewards member the Executive room in the basement has limited food and drinks and 2 computers for internet access but you have to get a password from the business office which is a PITA. Internet access from your actual room costs I think €7/day which we didn't use, opting for the free access in basement. We just ate in town and grabbed snacks from the Executive room. That said getting to/from Rome is not a big deal, sure you could take a cab at €30 each way or take the once-every-2-hour-drop-you-off-away-from-everything shuttle at €12pp but we found taking the local commuter train was relatively convenient (and most importantly inexpensive). Just buy a combo bus/train/metro ticket from the tobacco store in the lobby (€1/pp each way) then walk about 200 yards across the parking lot to catch a bus, route 127 I think. About 5 minutes away it drops you off at the Muratella station, trains come every 15 minutes during the day, 30 minutes nights and weekends. If you don't speak Italian and are unsure when you get on the bus just say "Muratella" to the driver- he/she will understand and stop the bus at the station. Take the commuter train to one of the stations that intersect with one of the Rome metro subways, we usually used Ostiense, then jump onto the Metro to get to the sights. About 45 minutes total transit time on average so you lose what, 25 minutes, from using a taxi. Since we were in Rome for several days we bought a BTI tourist pass 3 days for €11, this let us ride every form of public transportation instead of having to buy tickets each way. As far as staff and rudeness goes it is the same as anywhere- you get what you give. If you are polite, smile, ask instead of demand, the staff responds in kind. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Too far from the city center”
Reviews.Author: hankieladie
Reviews.Content: This is not the place to stay if you want to tour the sights of Rome. Although this huge convention center is very well maintained and staffed, it is a 30 minute shuttle bus ride from Rome Centro. The shuttle only runs every 2 hours. So, if you miss the bus you are out of luck! It is also about 30Euros to take a cab from the city or the Termini train station. Breakfast is the typical overpriced big hotel affair and you must beg for a cup of morning coffee.

Reviews.Title: “No security, no service, no one to answer the phone, no working AC in our room”
Reviews.Author: JayDorval
Reviews.Content: Staying at this hotel was one of the worst traveling experiences I have had. When we needed assistance they did not answer the phone at the front desk or concierge for at least 12 hours. Glad we were not having a medical emergency! The room doors do not lock properly and need an extra push or pull to secure them. I mistook our room and flashed the card and was easily admitted to the wrong room. We were very careful with our door after that. The AC failed around 1am and after trying and trying to get the front desk to answer the phone, my husband had to get dressed and go down to the desk for help (twice). Then they moved us. We asked for breakfast and they pointedly asked if we (a couple) would like breakfast for one? The duty manager was dismissive about our safety, security and rest concerns. Never have we seen a lobby with so many unhappy guests. For this service they charged us the full rate and once I complained they finally reversed the charges. If this is the standard of care from a Marriott I would look elsewhere! The room was very nice but that was all the positive I can say about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Only if you have to”
Reviews.Author: TallyfromNYC
Reviews.Content: I went there for a conference. Did not realize until later that this place is 40 min away from the city by taxi or a shuttle bus. As a business hotel it is Okay (pretty lobby, good conferenc facilities, good spa, nice deco in rooms), but that is all. Also, everything is overpriced (got charged 16 euro for a few hours of internet use). The coffee is undrinkable. Also, my cable broke and I asked two days in a row to have it fixed. Nothing was done.

Reviews.Title: “The worst staff I ever met (out of 150 hotels visited)”
Reviews.Author: KataAtali
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the middle of nowhere. If you travel to Rome to go sightseeing, do not stay in this hotel! There is only one bus connecting this location with the trains going to the city centre. Not only that this bus is scheduled only twice per hour on weekends but it is full of homeless people who live in the hotel's neighbourhood. So don’t go for a walk outside of the hotel area in the evening, it just does not feel safe. We wanted to take a taxi to get to the hotel but could not catch a one on the street. So I called reception of the hotel and they informed me that they can not call me a taxi and advise me to take a bus. So I waited almost an hour for this bus and when it arrived it was totally full so I could not fit in it... not mentioning that it was full homeless gypsies. Well, if you stay in 5-star hotel, you are probably not willing to take such a bus ride, right? Or maybe it’s just me... When I complained at the reception, they have just told me that they recommend public transportation to all guess and they can not do anything about other travellers on the public bus.... And they can not call me a taxi to pick me up outside the hotel (why? – that they were not able to explain). I tried to call taxi myself but they did not speak any English. Anyway, I discussed this with MoD but he was just rude and did not want to listen to me. He said there is nothing he can do about it and left... he just said that he does not care how guest will come to the hotel. Well, interesting answer from MoD. At least he could say that he is sorry and give me phone number of taxi where they speak English... In the end we decided to take a shuttle bus to the city centre and to the airport following day. Staff was just not helpful again, we had to wait at least 10-15 min to buy shuttle tickets to the airport (staff just ignored me while I waited at the reception desk - too busy laughing and discussing something more important....). In the end bus was 20 minutes late because driver did not show up on time and staff could not reach him on his mobile phone. Just to cheer you up in the end - guess what staff of this hotel use to stop the door from moving?! Fire extinguisher. I could not believe my eyes! We were passing by the conference centre where one of the fire exits was opened. Waiters were bringing there some food so they just take fire extinguisher from the wall and put it by the door to keep it opened! I feel truly sorry for Mr. Marriott whose name is hanging on the door of this hotel! I love Marriott hotel but this one was truly horrible (and nice room and comfy bed just did not pay off for terrible location and unhelpful staff).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, friendly and helpful staff, long ride on public transport to sites.”
Reviews.Author: Janice051
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Marriott because of our reward points. It was a lovely hotel, nice rooms, friendly staff, good restaurant. Because we used public transportation it was a long ride to and from the Vatican, the Roman ruins, and the Trevi fountain. No one told us that the last train stopped running at 10:00 p.m. We missed the train and got stuck downtown late at night. After some time we were able to hail a taxi--some nervous moments! I would recommend that if touring downtown Rome that you stay at a downtown location.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: joeysgirl88
Reviews.Content: I read all the mixed reviews before booking this hotel, but decided on it in spite of the bad ones. Glad I did. I don't know if there is a different staff working there at different times, but we checked in Sept. 24, 2010 and out Sept. 30. The front desk spoke excellent English every time we were in contact with them, along with Concierge and the Business office. We had breakfast there once, and the staff spoke English, and they, along with everyone else was friendly and very helpful. Food was good, but yes, pricey. The rooms are great-big, separate bathrooms-tub and shower. Beds are COMFORTABLE! Went to Rome with my husband, and my sister and brother-in-law. They all loved the hotel too. Only drawback is the location. But the shuttle-which is a full sized bus, not a 16 seater- at 10 euros, roundtrip worked out fine for us. You can walk from the stop everywhere is city center. If you want a great tour company, contact acrossrome. com. They are GREAT! And they prices are competative-we checked. Service excellent. Have a great time! Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “good for what it is...”
Reviews.Author: meetjimbo
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a hotel that is right in the heart of Rome, walkable to all the city has to offer, keep looking. However, if you are in town for a short meeting, desire the Marriott brand and are interested in saving a few dollars over the higher cost of being in the city, then this is a good property. The staff was very friendly, the hotel was clean, the rooms large and well equipped. This is a conference and meeting hotel that is good at being just that. The hotel does provide transportation (for a fee, 15 euro round-trip IIRC) to drop you off in the heart of Rome. The bus leaves the hotel every 2 hours starting at 8am with the last return back to the hotel from the city at 2300. This is perfect if you want to experience Rome for day. The hotel also has a van service for 10 euro each way to and from FCO airport, but call ahead to schedule a pick up from FCO. The only downside is the internet fees are very high and the accessibility is rather a cumbersome process as you have to provide your passport (italian law?) to get an access code to log-in. I was also not able to find many places within the city of Rome that had wifi hot-spots either...perhaps these modern advances are yet to come to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Fawlty Towers Italian-style”
Reviews.Author: C_Lam02
Reviews.Content: I was forced to stay here due to a Conference. I was thankfully aware that this place is located miles outside anything you'd want to visit in Rome as a tourist (or presumably as a local). I still didn't realise just how remote and unappealing the location would be. It's in a dusty, ill-kept, ugly intersection of a couple of a major highways, but with pretty much nothing within walking distance. That's fine, it's a conference hotel. But, it ain't good at that stuff either. With tired decor straight out of Liberace's dreams, and a service standard appropriate for a maximum security prison, there is little to recommend here. I tried dining in the ONE hotel restaurant a couple of nights. Look forward to a good hour wait for food, and odds are it won't be what you ordered. It was also the least impressive cuisine I've encountered in Italy. Lots of other things sucked. Internet is an outrageous 22 Euro for 24 hours. Coffees are 5 Euro. A gin and tonic set me back 18 Euro. This place is highway robbery, with none of the luxury you might want to associate with the expense. One slight positive was a good gym. And that the taxi trips into town are never as lengthy or as costly as the desk staff warn (although I suspect that they are just trying to convince you to use their tardy, infrquent shuttle). Avoid if you can!!

Reviews.Title: “Not for everyone”
Reviews.Author: capdail2006
Reviews.Content: If you like to spend your time at the hotel when on vacation, you could enjoy your stay here. But if you intend to go around the city of Rome a lot, stay elsewhere. The rooms are very good in this hotel. I stayed in a junior suite with British interior design on the sixth floor (the top floor) and I had a large balcony, a bath (in addition to a shower) and an excellent king-size bed. However, the quality of sleep wasn't great due to some disturbing lights and noises. There was a bright light that shone once a minute, and it seemed to be coming from far away outside the hotel compound. There was also a noise coming from inside the hotel that you could hear with your head on the pillow, probably some noise related to the infrastructure of the hotel. The breakfast served was nice, though not quite up to the 5-star level you'd expect in Europe. The walls between rooms were not made of bricks or concrete, so my bed shook when someone slammed their room's door nearby. All in all, good value for money since I did not go to Rome for leisure.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is far away from everything...”
Reviews.Author: rockyfordfan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is far away from everything. Although it does have a shuttle to FCO and downtown, the downtown stop is not very close to anything worthwhile. The hotel itself is isolated such that there is nothing nearby. Snacks and beverages are not sold on the premises, and the restaurant is very very very slow & dirty. There seems to be a lot of staff who do nothing at all. There was a long line to check in, a long line to check out, and constant waiting. On our last night we tried to order room service and the phone literally rang over 300 times and still went unanswered. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. The bed was good and otherwise it was miserable.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed there during DePuy event”
Reviews.Author: StevenNoulet
Reviews.Content: Very big, but 'cold' reception hall. Nice rooms, nice big beds, nice big & soft pillows. Swimming pool was closed (in the month of may....???!!!) No free internet... please... we are in 2010!!!

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time”
Reviews.Author: cdm34
Reviews.Content: The location is not close to downtown Rome. We did take Bus 128, then caught a train into downtown, then rode the metro to the sites we wanted to go. The hotel was pretty good except the location, but we didnt mind saving money and just taking what we did above. We actually used our Roma pass that covered all transportaion. They do have a shuttle, but it was expensive for a family of 4, ($40.00). We would start at 9am looking at sites and then come back arount 1pm (things close down during this time) then start back around 4 or 5pm and get back to the room around 10pm. If we would have done the shuttle we are talking 80.00 in Euros. I would have rather used our Roma Pass and save the 80.00 a day on somthing else. We were on the 6th floor and had a great view. We got the breakfast and it was free for us and it was awesome, our kids love the breakfast the most.There is a mini mart down the hill, which we made sandwiches for lunch which helped us save money on food. We also stored our fruit in the mini bar so we could snack on it. There is also a pizza place and gelato place close to the minimart but not as great as downtown food. The hotel wont tell you about it. If you have questions just email me.

Reviews.Title: “Sehr nettes Hotel, nah an unsere geschäftsbeziehungen in Rom”
Reviews.Author: DAS2010
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant business class hotel. We enjoyed being close to our business partners in this part of Rome and also the courtesy couch to the city centre. Enjoyed arriving and departing in taxis as I got the impression the traffic situation in this part of town was not brilliant. Rooms were as expected spotless and preakfast very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal!”
Reviews.Author: 4NDude
Reviews.Content: We travelled with two young kids and it is one of the few places in in Rome that accomodates families of 4. Two big beds, nice balcony and updated big rooms. Breakfast was good, actually quite good. We got upgraded so it was free but is is about 20 Euros/adult--combination of cold cuts and an American-style breakfast. Bar and lounge is quite reasonable. Had dinner one night on the balcony--pasta, fish and dessert--surprisingly good. Service was prompt. Hotel overlooks beautiful park so quite serine and quite--nice change from the chaos of Rome. We took a cab back from downtown--about 15 euros. Into town, took the shuttle and the metro--quite convinient. Our room on 1st floor had a view of the Vatican (and am told that on the 6th floor the views are even better). However, don't let the "room with a view" fool you--the Vatican is 20-30 mins away (with moderate traffic). Worth it if you are looking for an American brand and standards of Marriott Courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “do not stay here in you want to visit Rome”
Reviews.Author: goldstn
Reviews.Content: This hotel, while beautiful inside, and a great pool, including rooms, is a bad hotel for visiting Rome. The hotel, 7 miles from the city center, does NOT offer their own shuttle service to town, but contracts with a private entity that operates only every TWO hours, and charges $10 euros round trip- for our family of five, it only cost 30 euros for a taxi! The worse part of the hotel was its service- despite NOT being full, it took 90 minutes to get food in the restaurant for dinner, and after 30 minutes, I told them to forget the coffee. No one really seemed in charge. Worse, no one really seemed to care. The concierge lounge is the worse of any Marriott we stayed in Europe...

Reviews.Title: “Service needs to improve”
Reviews.Author: moritzb32
Reviews.Content: Always not enough employees for check-in, check-out, luggage locker etc. available - longer waiting times. Food was only mediocre and not balanced. Hotel is outside Rome, 30-45 minutes bus drives away from city center, however daily bus shuttle ervice available at Hotel Reception. Net, i would not recommend the Hotel for a private stay,

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, miles from city center, ambivalent service”
Reviews.Author: jamespascoe
Reviews.Content: we have recently stayed at this hotel, primarily to attend a conference..which was at Rome conference centre, not in hotel. Double whammy..needed a bus to conference centre as well as a bus into town. The hotel boast a shuttle. but only runs hourly. stops for lunch ( 3 hours) needs to be prebooked and costs 10 Euro return. For a family, not much in it between cost of taxi ( about 30E one way) and bus but significantly adds to cost of sightseeing or a meal out...no restaurant in the vicinity of hotel and hotel menu very limited and overpriced. Service very average. Pool facility good ( photo taken with a very wide angled lense!) but no service at pool. Rooms large and beds very comfortable and clean. Air con not working in one room. As other reviewers, if going to conference at hotel, fine otherwise go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome...”
Reviews.Author: travelbug_Boston_09
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, clean rooms, good conference facilities, pleasant staff and ultra comfy beds. BUT, and its a big but, it is located 30 + minutes from downtown Rome. If you need a good place to stay outside of the city then this is a great choice. If you are looking to experience Rome, then look elsewhere. The hotel offers a shuttle bus at regular intervals into the city and a taxi will set you back 30 Euros. Also, the hotel offers a good and reliable shuttle service to and from the airport for approximately 10 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but far from tourist attractions”
Reviews.Author: tivogirl752
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nites. Rooms very nice, comfy bed. We arrived via Roma Termini from Venice. Had printed basic instructions on how to get from station to hotel but evidently didn't have good info. Hotel site says to go to Piazza Cavour. Well there is a street near the train station called Via Cavour. We thought (incorrectly) that Piazza Cavour was close. Several taxi drivers didn't know where it was.
