Finally found a driver to take us and our luggage there, about 20 min taxi ride. He wasn't sure where hotel shuttle would pick us up. lots of construction around park and we called hotel to see what corner and then waited for bus. Web site needs better instruction for arrivals from train station. We also expected a pool. There is an outdoor pool but it is not pool season yet and it is closed. Indoor pool available in the spa for 10 euro/day. too pricy for us. Again, web site not clear on this. We didn't use the hotel shuttle to visit sites (10 euro round trip) but used city bus (it is free) then train & subway. pretty easy but long trip into town. Hotel free breakfast was good. didn't eat there any other times.

Reviews.Title: “This is a Marriott in name only - I would never stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: vegasrob
Reviews.Content: The biggest issue was that during our stay another guest walked into our room - apparently by mistake. That was bad enough - but then they basically did not believe us when we reported it. The service was less than friendly. The mini-bar was restocked one time during our one week visit. The hotel has nice rooms. Find a different Marriott. I visited with some other customers while in the lobby. They said the Courtyard gives great service etc.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel far away but hourly shuttle service”
Reviews.Author: maidmariner
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful, clean, excellent service. The restaraunt's food: breakfast was great especially when included with room which we asked for. We did not eat lunch but dinner did not have very many selections that we expected and it was expensive compared to restaurants in town. The hotel is located wayyyyyyyy far from Rome itself but there is a shuttle bus available on the hour except for a 2 hour break for lunch. There are only 16 seats and they fill up fast so you need to be there at least 15 minutes ahead of time going to Rome. I would suggest 30 minutes ahead of time leaving Rome back to the hotel. Overall great hotel, you just have to be prepared for the shuttle service and eat before coming back for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott room quality, Italian corporate service level”
Reviews.Author: ssimmer
Reviews.Content: 1 night for a conference Room quality was a bit over corporate standard, spacious compared to Rome. Nice marble bathroom and very comfy bed. Hotel well out of town near airport - not good for tourism. Service is a bit disinterested and occasionally over security conscious to point of rudeness. Catering is average , had forgotten hot water for conference beverage table a few times (attention to detail lacking.)

Reviews.Title: “It's Marriott, big and expensive but so good”
Reviews.Author: LennW
Reviews.Content: I like big full service hotels so this was a good choice for me when I had to wait one day for a flight. Professional staff swiftly checked me in and I was in my room within five minutes. This was appreciated as it was late and I had to get up early. My room was up to par with a five star hotel including flat screen TV, minibar, nice bathroom, very comfy bed and individual temperature control. Wifi not available but wired connection (for a fee) at the workdesk. I will not hesitate to stay here again if I'm in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “OK-Hilton Airport in a better location”
Reviews.Author: Mainers2
Reviews.Content: Typical reliable Marriott. Clean, safe and a little overpriced. No free internet, no complimentary brdeakfast. Room was comfortable but pillows were so hard they'd give u a headache. Staff was friendly and efficient. Shuttle to airport cost 8Euros!!!!! Coke in a room costs 4.5Euros, we can only imagine what room service items would costs!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Roma”
Reviews.Author: Apen33
Reviews.Content: Great culture, great food, gorgeous men! You must go to The Vatican and all the Basilicas. Hotel is Expensive, but near the historic sites.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect after 1 week in rome”
Reviews.Author: shopgirl007
Reviews.Content: Alright, the hotel IS NOT in rome, but if you´re able to read the hotel informations before you book a room there - it shouldn´t be a surprise for you! We spent one week in rome downtown which was very, very nice. Because of an early flight in the morning we decided to spent the last night closer to the airport and choose this wonderful hotel. The taxi was 21 Euro from rome downtown - alright - during August - nearly no traffic - that was for sure the reason why it was that cheap. Had a really nice check in with Alexander - very nice, gave us a room facing the pool area - impressive! Rooms are all very nice, clean, have superb beds, 2 bathrooms - amazing. The pool outside has a really nice view - we spent nearly 4 hours there - also opportunity to order something to eat and drink and SURE - it´s not cheap - why should they give you food and drinks for free - it´s there business like in all other hotels over the world which are outside from the main areas... if you have a car - perfect - if not - bring your drinks before you enter the hotel. Had dinner at their restaurant - with a very nice and very good buffet - including wine - was around 20 Euro/ person - is that expensive - I´m not sure. Went to the salad bar a few times and had very good parma ham and melon, 3 main dishes, bread, butter and some desserts. Slept very very good and reached the airport in the morning in around 20 minutes - no complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Inconvenience at a price”
Reviews.Author: EuropeLover_9
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a business trip that required I stay at this hotel. First the good news is that is a beautiful hotel and the rooms are great. The food is only fair and very very expensive. An expresso is 3 Euro standing at the bar (normally in town 1 Euro). A glass of wine at their mediocre restaurant was 9Euro. The food was very expensive with pasta about 12-14 Euros and meat and fish courses about 25-30Euros (it was only fair in quality to boot). The worst thing is the location which cannot be overstated!!! The staff is not helpful to get you where you would like to go. The hotel is not near anything!!! You need a car and that isn't so good. There are packs of wild dogs near the hotel towards the bus stop so walking around is a "hazard" . There is a No. 128 bus about 2 blocks from the lobby which the staff discourage you from taking. It gets you to the Muratello train station (FR!) which gets you to the city via Ostensie station(20 minutes) and the metro. BUT the bus stops about 50 meters from the train station on a road without sidewalks!!!! The train station is totally isolated and you would have to call a cab via your own phone (no payphones there). There is no ticket office in such suburban stations. The next problem is that the station maybe dangerous at night the are many gypsies taking the train and I suspect they live there. They regularly "beg" on this train (annoying but trivial). Down the hill on which the hotel is placed there are apartments being built and a small shopping area about a 20 minute walk (which maybe safe. I saw no dogs on this side of the hill). There is a terrific lunch place (the Lunch Kitchen which was great and cheap but only open for lunch. There is a great paticceria and bar as well and 2 pizza restaurants which are small,cheap and OK. There is a small supermarket as well. The hotel doesn't even tell guests about these stores which is a shame since they offer true local color. The people in the bar and lunch restuarant were wonderful!!!\ A car is absolutely mandatory but the GPS which is also mandatory was wrong in trying to get to a large mall about 5 miles from the hotel. The hotel is about 20 minutes from the airport which is convenient except during traffic and accidents add anywhere from 30 minutes or more. One fix albeit expensive is to get a car drive to the airport and park and take the express train to central rome. (parking plus the 11 euro train is expensive) but a cab from the hotel to Rome is probably 50 Euros and up depending on the traffic. This hotel has a convention center which is the reason to stay there. The rooms are nice but when in Rome stay in Rome!!!! Beware of the wild dogs on the property. You will see them if you stray outside the formal hotel boundaries. I am not exaggerating about the location which is terrible and the food which is expensive and very average. If you are adventurous taking the No 128 bus to Muratello station which runs early to late is a solution but keep some mace nearby for later night returns (I am not kidding). There are better and cheaper ways to stay in Rome or its environss

Reviews.Title: “lame,stubborn,understaffed,isolated and arrogant”
Reviews.Author: skatingelephant
Reviews.Content: The group rate , was up to E 70 per night more expensive than their standard rate. It nowhere near anything , really expensive , E8 per hour for internet , E8 to use the pool , as isolated as it was , crap coffee and expensive,staff were totally unprepared or rostered for the time of year , all up a massive dissapointment , senior management arrogant and argumentative , a huge gouge out of what was meant to be a great holiday , will try to never to stay at another marriott , 1 or 2 great staff getting crushed under the load a real pity.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel / Courteous Staff / Odd Location / Nice Visit”
Reviews.Author: kolasa03148
Reviews.Content: Used my Marriott points and knew from the start that the hotel was not in a central location. Stayed for 7 nights ... mild mix-up with the pick-up car arrangements but staff worked it out for me .. no problems there. Room was nice, spacious, clean and comfortable. Front desk staff (especially Leeandra) was excellent help. Did not eat in hotel but menu appearred to be Marriott overpriced. Shuttle into the city and out of the city 1 time each hour from 8 AM until either 8 PM or 9 PM .... drops you at the Ottaviano Metro Stop which is ideally next to the Vatican. Only downside to the free shuttle is that it carries ONLY 16 people .. no standing. Get there early or you are out of luck an onto a taxi. Frankly we wanted to stay out late one or two eavenings so the shuttle was actually a non-issue!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant rooms”
Reviews.Author: BigTipper
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for over night Rome stay, as it is between the airport and downtown Rome. Only stayed one night, so didn't get to explore the hotel extensively, but the rooms are really great, and the lobby atrium is very impressive. Two-room bathroom - tub, sink in one, and shower, sink, toilet in the other. Roomy, nice wood accents. All very new. Only disappoint was the bar and restaurant. Bartender/waiter was a bit snooty, and the restaurant would not let my wife order the burger that was available in the bar. Keep in mind that the bar and restaurant are next to each other, in the wide-open atrium, and that the restaurant is not in any way fancy. The food is made in the same kitchen, and the burgers were going right by us, over to the bar, as we sat in the restaurant. Didn't care for the can't-do attitude. Wait staff in the restaurant were totally disinterested in everyone, and we didn't see anyone getting decent service. Hotel is great, hotel staff are great, but don't go there hungry.

Reviews.Title: “Designed for thousands, served well to each of us”
Reviews.Author: BlankaAtImperial
Reviews.Content: This very new conference hotel is designed for large events, but served as a very good base for private exploring Rome. We arrived by car and conveniently parked in a huge lot on site. The quiet area was a nice contrast to busy city centre. The breakfast staff was very attentive and remembered my son's name the second day already. Do not be put off by the enormous size of the property, it was a good weekend choice.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel to saty”
Reviews.Author: xainab
Reviews.Content: i stayed in Rome for six months with my husband and for abt 2 months in rome marroit hptel. the environment and ambience of the hotel is awesome. plus its in outskirts of rome so the view from the hotel is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “A little off the track”
Reviews.Author: AngieS81
Reviews.Content: 20 Minutes from Rome city centre the location is not ideal but a shuttle service operates (charge applies). No shops or restaurants around unless visitors are willing to take a taxi. All the staff are very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was rather disappointing, as tables were not reset / cleaned and guest left waiting at their table. Pool area and bar are very nice.

Reviews.Title: “An expensive timewaster for anyone who actually wants to visit Rome”
Reviews.Author: citynerd
Reviews.Content: It is difficult to overstate how far away this hotel is from the sights of Rome. The best way to avoid being disappointed is to think of your stay as a stint at a very fancy prison. There is nothing worth visiting anywhere near the hotel: no restaurants, shops, parks, or other businesses. To get into central Rome, you must either ride the hotel shuttle (which only leaves eight times a day) to Piazza Cavour for six euro, or spend 25 to 35 euro on a taxi (which only comes when called by the concierge). Do not rely on the #128 bus that stops on the edge of the Marriott compound; it is unpredictable, and if it does come for you, you'll have to ride it for over 45 minutes to the end of the line at Basilica San Paulo just to get to a subway station. However,if you insist on taking the 128 bus, you may want to switch over to the train station at Muratella or Magliana for a faster shot to the subway stop at Roma Termini. Like big-name hotel chains in other countries, the more you pay, the less you get. This hotel has no free breakfast and no free Internet - not even in the business center. For the 200 euro or more that this place currently charges per night, you'd have no trouble finding a more conveniently located hotel in central Rome that even throws in a free hot breakfast. This is a pretty hotel with nice rooms and a decadent spa, but it is probably not going to work well for the average traveler (who probably wants to go sightseeing in Rome and start each day a lot closer to those sights). I thought about what would make this hotel work better for me, and I came up with the following list: - Your primary reason for staying is a conference, lavishly funded by a big pharmaceutical company or similar outfit that provides you with at least two catered meals a day, coffee breaks, subsidized wifi and shuttle vouchers. - When sightseeing, you plan a daily commute into town by reserving a round trip on the hotel shuttle and don't mind this commute consuming nearly two hours a day of your time. - You are provided with access to the modest executive lounge on the basement level, which has a small assortment of beverages and snacks and a PC with free Internet. - You are not concerned with the price of the rooms because you're paying with Marriott Rewards points. Without those things, a stay here can be a very frustrating. Despite how well the hotel looked, I found myself envious of colleagues who commuted in each morning from vacation apartments they were renting in town.

Reviews.Title: “Too isolated, too expensive”
Reviews.Author: Trombone34
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews before going - I had to attend a conference. There is absolutely nothing (!) off property within walking distance. It is €8 for a beer in the lobby. You are trapped. We moved from a BW hotel near Termini (which we strongly recommend) to the Marriott. The fixed price taxi wanted the same fare as the airport, €45. We took a public taxi, which had €31 on the meter. I printed Google directions, and the driver needed them. Some brave souls wrote reviews about the €1 bus to the Metro, and some conference attendees used it from downtown. One guy had to pay a taxi €20 from the Metro station for the 3 km to the hotel. Others took up to 2.5 hours to make this trip. You can believe the happy Metro users, or what I'm saying here; it's up to you. Wireless Internet is available at €22 per day. That is more than I pay for a month at home. The food was disappointing, although one dish (the seafood pasta) in 3 days was outstanding. Everything is so expensive, we found ourselves going without on a few things. We saved some money by bringing bread, cheese and wine with us from downtown. If you are desperate to use Marriott points, stay here. I think you'd be well advised to stay at a cheaper hotel downtown. The money you save on meals would pay for your room in a much more convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Spot”
Reviews.Author: sml779
Reviews.Content: We were in Rome for three nights, and loved this hotel. It was a little bit of a trek to some of the main attractions, but it's proximity to the subway and park were well worth it. The staff was friendly and helpful. We did have a problem with a blown fuse on our first night, but they quickly fixed the problem.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious, relaxing experience”
Reviews.Author: JeanineCharleston_SC
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the Marriott Rome Park, we were disappointed that it was not close in the the city. Once we opened the door to our room - WE WEREN'T GOING TO THE CITY! We peeked in at the room and balcony and instantly decided we were going to get over our jet lag in this most wonderful space. What a room! What a view! How lucky we are to have stayed there. And all this on Marriott points!

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont... the best place to stay in Montecarlo”
Reviews.Author: LeeHong
Reviews.Content: If you come to Montecarlo the Faimont is definitely the best place to stay. Excellent restaurant and bar with a grat view. The staff is always courteous, welcome and make me feel at home! Rooms are well decorated and offer great view. Without a doubt this is the best hotel I've ever stayed in Monaco!

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: fitgator
Reviews.Content: OK, so this hotel is not in the middle of anything, but that can be good. The hotel is in a nice neighborhood adjacent to a college. The hotel also offers transportation to the Vatican, which because this hotel sits on a hill, it overlooks. Make sure you are one of 16 people who get to ride this bus. Not 17. Not 18. 16 is the number. The bus drops you at one of the main train stations within a short walk of the Vatican. From this train station you can access all of Italy by rail. Very convenient if you go from there to other destinations in the country. The hotel has a gym but it was being fixed/renovated at the time so we ended up going for a run around the area. Lots of traffic so be careful when you are out there. There is a supermarket going up hill from the hotel and crossing into the main drag into the other side of the street. Make sure you get directions from the front desk. This was a very nice and comfortable hotel after a long day of sightseeing around Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelbugg787
Reviews.Content: Hi, For our 1st time in Rome, this hotel satisfied our needs very well. Yes it is out of the way for touring the city, but has a convenient shuttle bus, to airport & downtown. The bus is relaxing after exploring the city all day. Sorry to say there are not any nearby restaraunts. The hotel knows this and charges accordingly, but not out of line with any other hotel in EU. Service was always helpful & friendly. The pool was nice and closes @8pm, a bit early. One of the deciding factors for us to stay there was the spa, which was closed a day after our arrival. Unfortunately, this was not communicated to us on making reservations. I wanted the spa for my wife to enjoy. We would stay there again. Car rental is available, and they deliver to the hotel. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: vicmom710
Reviews.Content: we were very disappointed in this hotel. It took a good hour to an hour and a half to get into the city center. I thought the Marriott employees were surly. I found only a couple that were pollite. We had access to the executive lounge. After coming from Paris and staying at the Arch de Triumph and having access to their executive lounge, we couldn't help but compare. marriott had the same snacks out all day long. The pringles were always stale. I don't think they change them out at all. Hardly anyone used their executive lounge. The chairs were uncomfortable. The backs of the chairs hit you at the waist. The breakfast buffet was horrible. We had six in our family and none of us liked it. I just had cantelope every morning because that was the only good thing at the buffet. They say on their web site that they have sound proof windows. Well, maybe. But what about the doors.? We heard noise all the time in the hall ways. This is my first review to trip advisor because I was so disappointed in Marriott. We stayed at the Marriott in London on this trip and were very pleased. But this hotel was not a good experience. when you walk in they have a bunch of chairs and couches in the lobby that are exactly the same color and print. Who in the world decorated? It wasn't someone with experience or else they would have put a couple of colors together, not just the same color. DON'T STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel which worked well for us but please read before you book.”
Reviews.Author: matthewedward
Reviews.Content: We had a very good experience here but because we are seasoned travelers and researched this hotel we didnt have any issues. Be careful because there are issues you need to be aware of. Please keep in mind that I am a Marriott Platinum travel which entitled me to certain benefits which helped me with this stay here. The Good - This is a first rate hotel with beautiful, very comfortable rooms. The lobby is very nicely decorated and uniquely Italian. The Conscierge was extrmemly helpful and available M-S 8:00 - 17:00. We used the Executive Lounge (only available to Gold, Platinum and upgraded guests) which was stocked with snack food and drinks 24 hours. Breakfast was outstanding and as a Platinum memeber my entire family was "comped". There is a Sita bus stop outside the entrance gate which can take you to the Metroploitan train stop. From there you can go to the Airport (without swtiching trains) or into Rome by connecting to the subway. This worked for our family as we are adventurous but I caution you that it may not work for you. If you choose to do this and plan on staying 2 - 3 days I would recommend the "Roma Pass". Makes travel much cheaper, easier and gets you into 2 Museum sites fro free. The Bad - Food is very expensive. If we were not "comped" for breakfast it would have cost 27.50 Euro per person. The buffet was good but not that good. A simple hamburger was 18 Euros. Also, there are no restaurants around as this hotel is located in a business park so plan ahead for dinners and breakfast. Best advice is to eat in Rome. They do offer a shuttle however it costs 10 Euros per person for round trip. While much cheaper than a cab, this service is still pricey. We opted to take the bus (read above). The Ugly - This hotel is not centrally located in Rome. Shuttle ride is a half hour and doing the Sita bus/Metro Train/Subway connection thing we did takes about an hour. If you do this make sure you get the bus & train schedule from the conscierge. Honestly, it wasnt bad this way at all but my family and I love the adventure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent & clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mar_Sam_Jo
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my wife and a friend, the hotel is new and very clean - a typical 5 stars Marriott. Rooms are in good size, beds are very relaxing. The hotel staff are professional and friendly, all of them speak very good english. The hotel is far from the city - 25 minutes to Rome centre. There is a shuttle bus service that would cost you 10 euros for a round trip (bus is available every 2 hours from the hotel to the centre and vice versa). A taxi would cost you around 35 euros from the centre to the hotel. Food and drinks are extremely pricy - perhaps this is the main negative point. No shops, a supermarket or a restaurant near the hotel, so if you did not get your water, drinks, or food with you from the centre you will end up paying redicoulus amounts for it to the hotel. Although the hotel is far from the centre, I would defintly prefer coming back to this 5 stars hotel instead of paying treble the amount to stay in a same level central-location hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Eternal Roma”
Reviews.Author: govinda1
Reviews.Content: The lobby cum Restaurant of the Rome Marriott Park Hotel has a beautiful painted ceiling - worth looking up. The breakfast is good - could do with some more variety. Service is quick and efficient. Rooms are clean and very comfortable.Very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, just not in the center of Rome”
Reviews.Author: LAX_DEN_RON
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Rome Park is a beautiful new hotel with great amenities and a fantastic staff. The hotel is about half-way between Fiumicino and the center of Rome, so not within walking distance of anywhere, but they have a reliable shuttle that is Euro 10 to the airport and Euro 6 (one way) to the center of Rome (which is a great deal compared to a cab). The bed and bathroom in the room were top notch and the staff, both front desk and concierge, were very helpful and friendly. If you are in town for business, or a layover, this is a great place to stay. If you are in Rome to enjoy the sites, it is a bit far out of the way. The location is the only downside to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “okay to stay if using points”
Reviews.Author: taurustraci
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel, as I was using my points for my vacation and didn't have enough points for 4 days in the city center. This hotel is outside the center but does have a shuttle for 6 euro one way and 10 euro round trip into the city - which is great! However if you are going to miss your shuttle, it will be 30 to 35 euro back to the hotel from the city. The hotel is very nice, but there is nothing close by, no restaurants, nothing. So if you don't want to pay the hotel prices for breakfast, prepare yourself and grab something while you are in the city. Also if you decide to go to dinner in the area of the hotel, a cab starts out at 8,90 euro - since they are outside the city center, they charge from when you call them. the concierge told us of a mall and a restaurant to go to, the mall was non-descript and the restaurant he spoke of was no where to be found. then i talked to other people and they said they went to a local place that was pure italian and had the best food and it was only a 15euro cab ride away in the little town. So i guess it all depends on who you speak to at the desk. they also charge for internet usage in their business center - 7 euro an hour. i also stayed at the Sheraton Parco di Medici hotel across the highway from them and preferred that hotel (free shuttle to city and free internet; rooms were just as nice = and their pool was open as well) Not sure how you earn points with the Sheraton but it was only 95euro for the friday night stay and would've been 7,000 pts if I had points.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it if Staying on Points”
Reviews.Author: Moe457
Reviews.Content: My husband and I used our Marriott Points to stay here three nights in April, 2009. We got to be there for the Earth Quake, which surprisingly woke us up at 3:30 am, thankfully Rome was far enough away from the center. The points were significantly lower than the Grand Flora which is closer to Rome's center, and we figured it was worth the hundreds of dollars we would save. We got a little nervous as our trip got closer and we read a lot of the negative reviews on here. Here are some key take-aways 1. The Hotel has started offering a new Airport Shuttle bus from FCO. The cost is 10 Euro per person for a one way fare. This was a great convenience, and sounds like a big improvement from some of the negative reviews from earlier dates (people complained about the high cost of taxis) 2. If you stay at this hotel and plan on site seeing, just give yourself time to get to Rome in the morning. The shuttle bus service to the center of Rome was great... and pretty convenient (took about 30 to 45 minutes during rush hour... 25 to 30 minutes during other times). We would recommend that you don't book any tours before 9:30 am (10 am on the safe side) and you will be fine. An 8 am shuttle will get you into Piazza Cavour by 8:45 the latest... but then walking from there to your destination can take some time. Rome can be a confusing city, so give your self time to just wander and enjoy the sites. 3. The shuttle bus service was very convenient... though at 10 euro / person round trip... it can add up over a few days of vacation. In early April we had no issues with shuttle availability... the shuttle was a large bus, very new and modern, and there were always plenty of seats for us to sprawl out. 4. Public Transportation is a cheaper alternative. We took it one day in both directions. Only 2 Euro's per person each way. Just take the Bus 128 to the end of the line (they call it St. Paulo, but it has a different stop name). Then pick up the Metro (about a 2 minute walk from the bus stop). It was pretty easy.... though a little intimidating at first... because it is hard to know when to get off the first time you do it. The St. Paulo stop has a beautiful church (St. Pauls)... which is definitely worth looking at (though by the end of our trip we were pretty tired of seeing churches =)). 5. We also took a taxi one morning... we had an early tour, and realized the shuttle wouldn't get us there on time. THe taxi during rush hour was a big hurt on the wallet... cost 43 Euro to get to the center. Considering our train ticket from Rome to Florence was less than that... . So definitely try to avoid the taxis. 6. The concierge & front desk were VERY helpful and patient. We had a ton of questions, and they were great to work with. 7. Don't plan on spending any money at food at the hotel, unless you want to pay a fortune. We had a burger and a sandwhich, with fries... and the total cost was 34 Euro. The burger and sandwhich were very good, but no hamburger should cost 18 euro's. The nice restaurant was too expensive to consider. 8. One knock on the hotel is that the Fitness center and in door pool are not complimentary to the common person. Thats about it.... either way you will love Rome... what a great place to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Far from center of town but solid Marriott quality”
Reviews.Author: Kris0218
Reviews.Content: I don't doubt that this hotel has excellent business facilities, but if you're going to Rome primarily for a sightseeing/cultural journey, you're better off paying a bit more and staying close to the center of Rome. The hotel is newly remodeled and spacious with a new terrace-bar area and nice restaurant. The service was friendly and everyone spoke English. We were in one of the new, modern rooms with a balcony and a huge flatscreen tv that had internet access built in for €10 extra. There is a complimentary shuttle every hour into the city center that drops you off near the Ottaviano Metro stop, but it only seats 16 people and is first-come, first-serve. If you don't push your way onto the shuttle (and people do push!) then a taxi ride is about €20-25 to a similar drop-off point. On two occasions we split a cab with another couple who were also unable to get on the shuttle, which worked out well for everyone. Also, the last shuttle out of the city center is at 21:30, so if you're eating dinner at 20:00 or so, you're probably not getting on it. (And again, the shoving and lining up early to get on.) What you may save on your room rate, you may end up making up in taxi fares. There is a commuter train that stops near the hotel, but one night we waited an hour for it to no avail and finally took a taxi. The hotel's website says it's '15 minutes from the center', which is a bit misleading. Map it out. If you've got a car in Rome, I'd recommend this hotel. It's much more affordable than the ideally located Marriott Flora, but now we know why!

Reviews.Title: “Good American Style Business Hotel Outside The City Of Rome”
Reviews.Author: tommytourz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good business hotel located off the highway, high up on a hill so that it's quiet, but in an area that is of no interest to tourists. The concierge lounge was big but was lacking in service (trash, beverage and food replenishment) Complimentary Internet in the lounge is available for short time periods if you ask. The hotel room and bathroom were standard American fare- well maintained Check-in was excellent, check-out was extremely slow. Restaurant breakfast buffet was weak. This is a big property and large tour buses arrived and departed frequently. I like this hotel well enough that I would stay here again I just wouldn't go out of my way to stay here again. I rated this as "Very Good" for US Standards, for Rome Standards it may rank a little higher- ttz

Reviews.Title: “Quality Marriott - Need Patience”
Reviews.Author: hawkeyes
Reviews.Content: This meets traditional Marriott standards for room size, service, ambience, friendliness. 5 Stars for that. The hotel is about 10 miles from downtown and you need to reserve and take their shuttle. It drops you off near the Tiber on the Vatican side. Not expensive but if you go during rush hour, the trip may take 45-60 minutes. Same coming home. An alternate is a cab which cost about 40-50 euro and really doesn't get you there all that much faster. It is not really near the train or the metro nor night clubs or restaurants. Essentially, I think it is a business hotel A good Marriott hotel that meets their standards but a little out of the way for touring.

Reviews.Title: “Not ready for prime time”
Reviews.Author: flightlady
Reviews.Content: Hotel is not up to Marriott standards in quality of service even though they are a 4* hotel. The physical structure is new and pleasant. Prior to arrival, they promised help with a wheelchair and finding a local laundry. When we arrived the promiser was on vacation and we had no help for days. Finally a concierge gave assistance. They would not allow another guest to have a rollaway for his child even though he held a printed reservation in his hands stating so. Everyone was constantly charged for mini bar items they did not use, always someone at front desk complaining about this. Front desk gave different answers to same questions. Breakfast buffet had 45 minutes remaining yet cook flatly refused to refill numerous hot dishes, said he was too busy. In room phones were often inoperative. Car park valets are not available so you must park car yourself in lot which is 10 minute walk away. Luggage valets were rarely seen, we carried our own bags via hotel's cart. Hotel is 20-30 minutes outside Rome. Marriott bus has odd schedule and one drop off location. During our 7 day stay front desk could not exchange US$ or Traveller's Checks into Euro. They're not ready for prime time. Stay in town, not here.

Reviews.Title: “Soulless”
Reviews.Author: EMEATRAVELLER
Reviews.Content: Terrible location . Quirky rooms - OK if you like Baroque style with a modern twist . Only redeemed by above average service from staff and excellent icecream in lobby bar !!Dont know who designed the lobby but there last job must have been a warehouse or railway station .

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, OK service, terrible location...”
Reviews.Author: tinamagill
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, american style. US room size, clean, accomodating, very american. BUT... the property is isolated and you cannot walk around as per the concierge "there are wild dogs" surrounding the prooperty. I saw a pack of them as I walked to the bus stop. Taxi ride to center city is 20-40 euros depending on time of day. You can buy a bus ticket from the gift shop for 1 euro to take the bus to the metro and the metro to the city. This takes a while buts saves good money. The hotel provides a shuttle, but it is 10 euros round trip and you must book and pay in advance. If you miss your time, you lose your money. Food at the hotel is pricey and just ok. Most employees speak english. Check your bill--upon checkout I found some charges that are still being disputed. The woman behind the desk was rude and not helpful at all. Alex is great at the front desk!

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!!”
Reviews.Author: aemassi
Reviews.Content: Few words: There's all you need, huge and luxurious hotel with all kind of services, American style breakfast with tons of food. The best hotel I've ever seen. Located in the periphery of rome not in the centre, I always moved by Taxi. Only a negative note: parking for guests not free and payments must be done by few automatic cash sometimes with queues.

Reviews.Title: “Nice New Hotel, but far from it all”
Reviews.Author: 1sweetcandygirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is closer to the airport than to Rome, but unless you take a cab you will have a long commute anywhere you want to go. It is far from civilization. They have an unreliable shuttle service so we took the subway and a bus just to get anywhere. I considered it an adventure to travel this way, but my husband didn't feel safe. People jumped out of the tall grasses to catch the bus and blue collar workers actually started wrestling on the bus once. With that said, the hotel was great! We had two bathrooms in our room with beautiful marble. This would be a cool place to have a conference if you ever had a reason to do one in Rome. For the general tourist, I wouldn't recommend it since it is so remote.

Reviews.Title: “You Will Regret Making this Choice”
Reviews.Author: Karen1567
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not worth a stay, even at 1/2 the price. All the other reviews are true. It is in the middle of nowhere-indeed, you could be anywhere in middle-America. The decor is tacky-as if they opened a hotel in the Italy EPCOT pavilion at Disney World. The service is rude; they are only looking to make money by nickle and diming for everything (the "restaurant" would not allow me to order dessert to take to the room, the "Executive Lounge" would not allow you to take out a cup of coffee, etc.) The worst thing was we booked the hotel for the pool faciliites, thinking we would have a relaxing evening by the pool before our flight home, and arrived to find the pool closed for a private event. The facilities are laughable for the price charged. The restaurant was the quality of a mall food court. The 25 euro breakfast buffet consisted of cappuchino and pastries-the cheese on the buffet was rancid. Please, do yourself a favor and find a hotel closer to the center of Rome where people care about your experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Englishdreams
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at the Marriott Rome at the end of an Insight Italian Escapade Tour. I am sure it was booked there because of proximity to airport. Room was best I had in Italy entire 14 day trip. Wonderful beds. Great bathrooms. Hotel clean. Bar great. Breakfast buffet no so great, actually very skimpy. But if you are tourist this hotel is way out of town...am sure it is great for business but not so for being in the thick of Roma...unless you like crowded trains.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel at all costs”
Reviews.Author: Seismic
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night stay at this hotel while attending a conference /exhibition at the new Fiera di Roma. We were late bookers so had little other choice. The hotel as it stands is ok, clean and with comfortable rooms but it is miles/kms from anywhere. Almost all journeys will be made by taxi at 30-35€ for central Rome and 25€ for the Fiera which is close to Fiumincino. There is a bus service from the hotel but it becomes full very quickly and the last one back from the city is at 23:00. It is also rather expensive and breakfast is extra as normal. We had Executive Lounge passes for an inclusive breakfast but the whole experience was so dire that we elected to eat in the foyer restaurant and refused to pay their 27€ charge. Read the other reviews with which I agree wholeheartedly. If your company is sending you to a conference in the hotel, fine. But if you are on holiday and fancy some decent food and sight seeing, look for a hotel which is actually in Rome. Avoid this place, even if you are a Marriott fan.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: vkupcis
Reviews.Content: The other reviews are true, I will not mention again the location and prices. What I did not like at all was the way they handled my credit card. First of all they've tried to pre-authorized my card for the amount of full stay + 30%. I've explicitly has told them not to do that as I do not possess an extra 2000 EUR in my account. They pre-authorized 1000 EUR which was ok. Later on they did more pre-authorizations without letting me know, so by the end of my stay the whole bill was pre-authorized. On the check-out they successfully debited my account for the same amount. I know the hotel wants to be on the safe side, but in this case they must release all the pre-authorizations as soon as I pay my bill. Now I am forced to go into overdraft and pay debit interest on my account just because Rome Marriott Park Hotel is soooooo clever. And to be honest, the level of service is crap even by Italian standards.

Reviews.Title: “Honest review good and bad Marriott Park Hotel Rome”
Reviews.Author: luv2travell
Reviews.Content: We returned after staying six nights at the Marriott Park hotel in Rome. First I would like to do a fair review both the positives and neg of the hotel. The positives are the hotel itself is beautiful! The rooms are very large for Europe. The bed was extremely comfortable. The spa and fitness center was great also. The negatives are first the hotel does not have a shuttle service from the airport to the hotel and beware the taxis do rip off the tourist. We read this here on a previous review and was surprised the cab fair was over 80.00 euro The hotel said yes they have heard of the cabs charging even over 100 euro ! The other big neg is that it is a 30-45 min one way shuttle ride into Rome which doesnt leave until 8am so if you want to get into the city early you have to take a cab. The shuttle is 10 euro/per person which isnt bad but you either end up staying in Rome all day or going twice if you want a break in the midday. I would not recommend this hotel for anyone wanting to see Rome but it would be great for an out of the way place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Just know what you're getting”
Reviews.Author: worldtravellor12345
Reviews.Content: We knew what we were getting with this hotel, so we weren't disappointed. Here's the deal: Great hotel. Nicest facilities you'll see unless you're staying in a big name or a fancy hotel. The rooms are huge. Bathrooms are spacious. Great amenities. But... You're 30-60 minutes outside of Rome, and the shuttle bus costs 10 euro per person round trip. It leaves every two hours from both spots. Now for us that wasn't a problem - the bus didn't fill up either of the two days we were there, so we had no problem taking an early bus there and a late bus back. We went to Rome for Rome, not the hotel, so we didn't mind that. We accepted it because we used Marriott points to stay for free - couldn't beat the price. Also, getting to the hotel from the airport requires work. A cab is around 50 euro or so, which we didn't want to pay, so we took a train and then a bus. Cost only 10 euro for 2 people, which was great, but took an hour and it was a bit bizarre to see a pack of dogs sitting on the grass outside the fence of the hotel as we rolled our suitcases from the bus stop to the hotel doors. Nevertheless. As long as you plan for what you're getting, this hotel is just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if your company is paying”
Reviews.Author: bubba89
Reviews.Content: Like previous reviews the hotel is a convention (American) hotel located too far from the city of Rome and the airport to be cost effective. We stayed one night because our flight to ATL left early in the morning and the Courtyard was full. The taxi cost to and from the airport was more than our room. It would have been cheaper to keep our rental car and pay the overnight parking fee. The legal rate one way to and from FCO is 35.00euros. The hotel itself is nice though the lobby can get very loud due to the atrium feel. Two small beers and 2 pasta entrees....60euros...ouch! Like I said if you are there on business and your company is footing the bill, no worries, otherwise be prepared for the sticker shock. (Did like the two bathrooms in the room though).

Reviews.Title: “Convention Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gkaylor
Reviews.Content: This is a bright and shinny hotel for business travilers. Its is not someplace to stay for a week whale you see Rome. Long bus rides into Rome, 45 min. to over an hour to get into Rome. Food prices out of sight. Most employees seem like they would reather be someplace else. This hotel is set up to cater to the business traviler who are on a expence account.

Reviews.Title: “Taxi's are a rip-off food prices very high!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: GMT59
Reviews.Content: We used Marriott points for our recent stay at this hotel and were there for 4 nights. Being a Platinum member we had access to the Executive Lounge which was fine. It was very welcoming to come back to the hotel after a long day in Rome and go and have a cup of tea or cappuccino and some snacks. Dinner was another subject and to pay Euro 18 for a hamburger was a bit over the top and during the week they charged an additional 5 Euro for the salad/antipasto bar which we found amazing!!!! Taxi's well what can we say we were almost ripped off once and managed to come away paying what was on the meter and not the extra quote Euro 10 surcharge yes there was already an amount on the meter when the taxi arrived at the hotel on another occasion. There is no shuttle service to the airport which is about 10-15 minutes away therefore you have no option but to take a taxi and that cost us Euro 40 for a ten minute ride at 90 miles per hour, you do the math!!!! Our first choice was the Marriott downtown but in order to use your points there was nothing available for at least one year, we kept checking. This is not a hotel we would stay at again because it is overpriced and they are obviously used to companies paying the bill for conventions and really it is not for the likes of tourists!!! We stay at Marriotts on many occasions being a Platinum member and this did not have the Marriott feel. We recently stayed unexpectedly at the Marriott Denver Airport and it was fabulous!!! Boston, Massachusetts

Reviews.Title: “Way out of town”
Reviews.Author: kiwitripper64
Reviews.Content: The Marriot is too far out of town. If you are in Rome to see Rome, then you do not want to be 30 minutes away by shuttle bus at 10 euro return. The hotel is typical ambiance free accommodation with all services. Staff range from friendly and very helpful to surly and not caring at all. There are no shops nearby, so if you want a piece of fruit etc be prepared to take shuttle into city and back. We stayed because of business, but as soon as meetings were over we ditched Marriot in favour of small private hotel in Rome central.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: zj2007
Reviews.Content: We were traveling to Rome w/teenagers but quality hotels were expensive so we took our trust in a Marriott Hotel a little off the beaten path and it paid off. We visited this hotel before it was completely finished (the pool & spa we not available) however the experience was wonderful - we booked 2 rooms. It is simply a Modern Italian Beauty - and tasteful decor, and 2 bathrooms in each hotel room!! However it is a 50 euro cab ride into the city. At the time we stayed the hotel offered a free city shuttle service - and this made our stay incrediable. We traveled into the city from 9:00 am until 8:00 everyday of over holiday - and returned to a beautiful modern establishment. Value for the Price - uncomparable in Rome! We have booked it again in August 2008.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Shuttle Bus!”
Reviews.Author: pollywotsit
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week and had a great holiday. Although as previously stated, hotel is some way out from Rome - the shuttle bus service is excellent. However, this is no longer free (which came as a complete surprise to us) - 10 euros per person for round trip but well worth it - frequent, efficient and reliable. Drops you at Piazza Cavour from where you can easily walk to most of the best attractions. The shuttle did suit us and at this time of year it was easy to book (sometimes with five minutes to spare!). In high season I understand it's much busier and best to book in advance. Sometimes we returned on an earlier shuttle than we had booked - as long as there's room on the bus that is no problem. Hotel was excellent, our room was most attractive and comfortable with a lovely bathroom. The restaurant for breakfast was very good though I cannot comment on the evening meals as we did not eat there. Found all staff very pleasant and helpful. Yes, the hotel is miles from anywhere so no strolls in the evening (yes we did pass a few of the wild dogs as we went past on the bus but they seemed to be no problem). We viewed the seclusion as a bonus - nice and quiet and pollution free. If you are out for the evening - the last shuttle pick up to return to hotel is 11.00 p.m. Recommend this hotel wholeheartedly - our first visit to Rome and we found it a wonderful place with the Colisseum being the highlight for us.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms but the hotel is way overpriced”
Reviews.Author: mgilbert_twa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is relatively new and the rooms were nice, but the service was horrible, the location was the worst - the food and beverage was poor and overpriced - the charges for internet and telephone were highway robbery. I have stayed at other hotels in Rome that were better located, better value, and did not overcharge for food, beverage, or business necessities like phone and internet. I will never stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Er_Pichi
Reviews.Content: We used Marriott points for the four nights, and enjoyed our stay. Since this was early January there were no conventions and best of all the shuttle bus was not full so we had no problems going to or coming from the center of Rome. We had rented a car based on the reviews I had read and am glad we did, since we were able to go out to some of the restaurants that were in close vicinity 3-5KM from the hotel for dinner, and to see other parts of the Lazio province. We stayed away from the hotel restaurant due to the prices and the fact that we preferred to eat elsewhere. The only item that we were not happy with during our stay was that the room temperature was too warm, and with the thickness of the down comforters even with the air on all night it was too hot, we ended up opening the window to get fresh air and sleep more comfortably. The service at the concierge and front desk was excellent and they answered all of our questions. I would imagine that the large swimming pool would be of great use in the summer time but obviously with it being outdoors it is not an option in the winter time.

Reviews.Title: “The most horrible hotel experience EVER”
Reviews.Author: i_like_2vacation
Reviews.Content: My first impression of the hotel was a positive one. It was very clean, looked new, had an open feel, friendly check-in staff / luggage guy. But it ended there. Well our room was nice too. This was the most overpriced, rip off hotel I’ve ever stayed in. I will quickly go through the items that annoyed me... 1. Internet access highly expensive, if I remember correctly $25 for 4 straight hours, once you pay, the clock starts ticking. 2. It costs $50 to swim in the indoor pool and use the sauna/steam room (also where you can find the life guard who watches your every move to tell you to lower your voice, wear a hair cap, and anything else he wants. 3. The bar is overpriced 4. This hotel is not a hotel to stay at if you are visiting Rome. It is 45 minutes from the center of the city. I did not stay here to visit Rome, but if I had, I would have been very very upset. The hotel tries to sell itself as a hotel to stay at when visiting Rome, and you should be aware of that. 5. The restaurant staff was not friendly or accommodating. (at least the ones we had to deal with) I do realize that my experience may be unique and that not ever member of the staff is rude, or unfriendly, but there were just too many problems that happened to me in a one night stay, that I can not give this hotel a higher rating. Employees aside, I still feel like this hotel was too expensive, and did not offer the same level of service that I’ve received from other hotels of the same price. I obviously will never stay at this hotel again. I should also point out, I have no problem with Marriott, they actually gave me a partial credit due to my experience. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Fun stay, great service”
Reviews.Author: PebbleBreeze
Reviews.Content: Because I wanted to avoid driving/parking in Rome, I booked a family vacation here. The upshot: great service, luxury accomodations, spa, indoor/outdoor pools, great food, efficient shuttle service. It was so nice not driving at all, taking in a massage and Turkish bath, and enjoying full days in Rome. If you visit Rome during hot weather, this place has a big pool. Its a new hotel and is well appointed. The only weird moment was when we had dinner at the restaurant and there were 4 seater tables and 4-5 waiters, and we had lousy service. But the breakfast service was top notch as well was the spa service. Other weird thing: cost of room service and wet bar (6 euros for a can of Pepsi, 25 euros for coffee and toast to room). I mean come on - that's a little insulting and rude.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!! Staff Rude”
Reviews.Author: anne12345
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent and booked 3 night using my marriott rewards at a discounted rate. I knew the hotel was outsideof Rome but didnt know alot of things and wished i had logged onto this website prior to making my booking. After everything is said and done and we stayed there, knowing now, no one can pay me to even stay there again Nor will I Ever Refer this property to any one of my clients and co workers. Like many reviewers here have said, be prepared if you are Not here for a convention or meeting, stay the heck away!!!!!! I'd rather pay a higher rate in Rome, than stay here. The taxi drivers are rip offs. They will charge automatically 11 euros for coming to the hotel when they are called. We all know that they have some kind of deal with the hotel because of the distance to where the hotel is, doesn't mean that Italians should rip off tourists!! shame on them! The rooms were clean but very small. Front desk when we checked in, the lady was so rude!!! she didnt even say welcome to our hotel, nothing. as if we were lower class people than herself...all the staff is very rude!!! beware. the restaurant inside the hotel, again because they can rip off, they sure do! 19 euro for hambuger. soda 5.00 euro!! in a small glass bottle. the shuttle bus was nice, but no one told us when we checked in about needing a ticket to get on the bus and to come back to the hotel. the driver was the nicest out of all the staff there. why must we have tickets to get on the bus? as if someone who isnt staying there would want to get a ride from rome to the hotel, and be stranded in the middle of no where with rude people!! we stayed there 3 nights and were so happy to leave!! we left for florence, for a 5 star luxury property and boy did we need it!! after staying at this smuck of a place!

Reviews.Title: “Wasted our points - NEVER again!”
Reviews.Author: TravelLovers2
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for our honeymoon in Italy knowing that it was far away, but since they had a shuttle service we thought this would help. We also expected to take some taxis since some of the tours we took had earlier times than the start time for the shuttle. But, what we didnt expect was to have three taxi drivers tell us that they didnt know where the hotel was located. We had to take cabs about 8 times and spent well over 200 euros. Relying on cabs is very frustrating because they are very dishonest. BE AWARE! By the time the cab gets to the hotel, you are charged 11.40 euros. We asked about this and were told that cabs start charging from the moment they receive the call. I have never heard of this before. The hotel restaurant was good but after a few days eating there, it starts getting old. People kept asking for restaurants outside the hotel and they were told that there was one 10 mins away. Dont believe that, we were told the same about the mall and it was farther and cost us 25 euros by cab. The staff at the hotel front desk appears helpful but they seem to say what you want to hear even though it's not true. When we complained about cabs not knowing where they were, we were told to call them and they would send us a cab, well we did and they flat out told us that they could not send a cab because they were not going to be responsible for the cab fare. We were stuck at a mall by the airport because of this and had to rely on a very nice local lady that took us to another marriott hotel that was then able to call us a cab. By the way, if you are used to staying in Marriotts like we are, dont think the little store inside the hotel is part of Marriott because they are not. We made a purchase there and were told that we could not charge it to the room because they are independent from the hotel. I have never stayed at a Marriott that had this set up. Overall we feel we wasted our points and spent more money and aggrevation than if we would have paid for a hotel in the city. Dont stay here unless you are planning to attend a convention and plan to stay in the hotel the entire time. We found ourselves in Rome waiting hours so we could take the shuttle at 11pm.

Reviews.Title: “Bad choice.”
Reviews.Author: Maveperth
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel with our 3 children while my husband attended a conference. The hotel itself is well appointed and clean and comfortable, however it is located well out of town and is very isolated. It does run a free shuttle service into Rome on a regular basis, but be sure to book your seat a couple of days before or you wont get on. The staff were rude and unhelpful making us feel like we were an inconvienence to them. Because of the isolation there is nowhere apart from the one hotel restaurant to get food and they are very expensive. You can't even walk to a local deli or shop. Taxi's to and from the hotel charge what they like and argue when you ask them to use their meters. We would definately never stay there again as there are far better and cheaper options closer to civilization!

Reviews.Title: “Standard Marriott”
Reviews.Author: ka85pow
Reviews.Content: Let me start out by stating that for our stay we used points. Overall, the hotel itself was very nice. The staff was attentive and friendly, although did have a hard time with too few people available at the check-in desk at certain times. I tried to change money (a large bill for several smaller), and the transaction took well over 15 minutes. Being a gold member, we were afforded the breakfast buffet as part of our stay. The buffet was very nice, with a good variety, and depending on the time of morning, the staff was very friendly. The location was not the best as mentioned by most of the reviewers. It is well outside the city, and depending on traffic could take up over an hour to get into the city. Not the best thing when trying to catch an early tour. Once at the hotel, you are stuck at the hotel. The options for food are limited and fairly expensive. Entertainment is non-existent for English speakers as the tv had 2 channels in English. Not a huge deal, but when having to plan your travel times to and from the city proper well in advance, once you are in the hotel, you are there for the evening. The trip from the train station to the hotel took a long time, but most of that was spent in line waiting for a taxi. Since it was a Sunday, we were told by our driver that most of the other drivers take the day off. We were approached multiple times while standing in the taxi line by random "drivers", offering to take us where we need to go. When asked why they chose us and not people before us in line, they all of a sudden did not speak enough English to understand our questioning. When all was said and done, we stood in the taxi line for 1 hour and 15 minutes, and then took an unplanned tour of the city to get to the hotel. The fee ended up at around 60 euro. I recommend this hotel as long as you can schedule your time well and are ok with starting your day in Rome at 9:15 or so, since that is the earliest the bus can get you in.

Reviews.Title: “Like No Other Marriott”
Reviews.Author: TouristTrap
Reviews.Content: Unless you're staying on business for an on site convention, I would recommend staying at another hotel. This is definitely not a destination for tourists on vacation. For the most part, the staff acts as if they have better things to do than take care of their customers. Good luck having someone pick up a call made from your room for information. There is one restaurant and you will pay a king's ransom for sub par food and service. The shuttle bus heads into Rome on the even hours(8am - 10pm) and returns on the odd(9am-11pm). You will need to make reservations with the concierge for the shuttle service....and they book up fast..and they can be reserved up to 3 days in advance. There are no pick ups at the hotel by touring service companies, so you will have to take a cab into Rome because the departures for these tours are too early to utilize the shuttle. This will cost between 23 and 40 Euro, depending on the integrity of the driver. The rooms, health club and pool are first rate, but you're out in the middle of nowhere, within walking distance to nothing at all. If you're going to visit Rome, staying at this hotel is not the way to go.

Reviews.Title: “Will improve with time!”
Reviews.Author: Payam81
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the suburbs of Rome close to the Da Vinci Airport. It has a great shuttle service to Rome city center with regular departure times. It's more of a hotel for functions and has massive conferance capablities. My stay of 3 nights was quiet joyful and I had no major problems. Staff speaks very good English. Also they have a lovely gym with lots of equipment and bottled water at hand. Rooms are of a good size considering it is Europe and the bathrooms are very modern and stylish. Keep in mind the service does have some shortcomings but considering this is a brand new hotel I believe all of the kinks will be out of the system whitin a year and they will be operating just like any other top Mariott property!

Reviews.Title: “Not for the Rome tourist”
Reviews.Author: Moises07
Reviews.Content: I can't complain about the location because I knew in advance that this hotel was way out of the way. For that reason make sure you call the hotel PRIOR to your arrival so you can secure a spot on the shuttle that leaves from Piazza Cavour every two odd hours. If you don't, and there is no room for you, you will have to pay around 60 euros for a taxi. Do not try to make it to the hotel through the metro because according to the staff it is located 5km from the hotel, and it is really tricky to find your way there. The shuttle service is great but I suggest you book it for the length of your stay as soon as you get there. If you are not wealthy please make sure you have your meals in Rome because the restaurant in the hotel is extremely expensive and once there you can't walk anywhere else to grab a bite. It seems they are taking advantage of their location in the middle of nowhere by overcharging for the meals, a burger will run you 19e($24.) If you don't mind any of the above then I'm sure you are going to like this hotel since it has very nice clean rooms, with flat screen TVs, and other amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Conference Hotel in the middle of nowhere”
Reviews.Author: ABroach
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Park isa brand new (opened begining June 2007) hotel which claims to be the largest conference hotel in Europe. It is located halfway between the airport and the city, in an industrial estate dominated by a huge Toyota building. It had only opened 20 days before we arrived for a conference. My wife had never been to Rome and imagined romantic views of the city etc. Sadly the hotel is not "in Rome" at all and apart form views of the industrial estate, seems to offer vistas of the nearby motorway and some rather flat countryside. The hotel is basically a standard Marriott with good rooms, furnishings, high speed internet etc plus two enormous exhibition sheds attached on either side of the hotel building. The area covered is vast and most delegates must have covered miles by the end of the conference. On the plus side, the rooms were good and had nice touches like 2 bathrooms. The hotel runs a very efficient free shuttle system to the center which takes between 40 minutes and 1 hour depending on traffic. On the negative side, it is not an attractive location and you have no concept of being in Rome. The hotel was obviously having teething problems. When 400 delegates came to check out there were 2 people on reception but they eventually found more. The conference rooms were good but there were problems with distracting noises from staff working nearby. There is a large outdoor pool and terrace whcih seems like a wind trap and could really benefit by being sheltered by trees as there is nothing to look at. One other thing was that no taxi drivers at the airport had any idea where the hotel is and charged sums ranging upto 60 Euros for an 11km journey. Should be about 25. If you are going there for a conference, great (once they have ironed things out) but it is not a place for a romantic Roman weekend

Reviews.Title: “In the Middle of Nowhere - Not for the tourist!”
Reviews.Author: greenjohn1
Reviews.Content: As the title says it is is in the middle of nowhere. Expensive to get to 58 euros from train-station. We may have been over charged but Marriott was not help in getting us there. 54 euros to airport set up by Marriott after they told us it would be these same as a taxi. Later we learned it would have been 15 to 20 by taxi. Did i mention it was in the middle of no where. Nothing to see or do. No local shops to get a refreshment or a cup of morning coffee. Only one restaurant in hotel. 28 euros for buffet breakfast, which was run of the mill. Room was fine except at about 2 AM it seemed the air conditioning cooling stopped and the room became hot and humid and around 6 AM it would start cooling again. Internet access 7 euros and hour. Laundry starting at 4 for a pair of socks. Did I mention it was in the middle of no where, so there are no other options. They have no help for touring Rome with tour/guide contacts. Their shuttle had to be booked for to and from Rome, with the last bus back at 11 PM. Rome is great! Stay in the city and then you can get up early and get to see the Sistine Chapel.

Reviews.Title: “Outside the City but very nice”
Reviews.Author: TravelwithZ
Reviews.Content: If you are planning a vacation to Rome you should understand that this property is outside the city - closer to the airport. It is clearly aimed at business travelers or someone with a rental car that does not want to drive into the city. We were very happy with our 2 night stay there. I think Jeagan99's review on May 15 2007 was right on the money regarding the hotel. As other reviewers have commented, there is literally nothing around this property, just a few office buildings and some housing. A free shuttle runs every 2 hours to and from the city. It takes 20-30 minutes but drops you off in Piazza Cavour, a fine location in Rome. The shuttle was extremely prompt and the buses were clean, air conditioned and comfortable. You have to book your time ahead so it may not be the right place for a family of 4 looking for a vacation hotel. As a couple that planned to spend their entire day in the city walking around, it was fine for us. If we had planned to use the hotel as a base and go back and forth, it would not have been a good choice. The property is very nice inside and by far the most comfortable room I stayed in at any of my hotel stays in Italy. The staff was extremely courteous and spoke excellent English. Overall, I felt very comfortable in my room. The rooms are spacious and our King bed was so comfortable we hated to get up in the morning. (other guests on the shuttle made the same comment). This hotel feels more like a better USA property with a spacious bathroom, a good shower with plenty of clean soft towels and a decent closet. It also had AC/heat that kept the room at the tempure we selected. A safe is provided in the room. The room and the hotel were spotless. The fact that it was a new building meant that it was more spacious and better appointed then some of the better downtown European hotels I have stayed at on this and other trips. The lobby area is huge with comfortable couches and a good size bar/restaurant area. A new pool was about to open in the next few days, it looked very nice. We did not eat at the hotel but we did notice that breakfast was pricey, even for a typical city hotel. The continental breakfast buffet was 15 Euros and the full breakfast buffet 27 Euros. At 1.4 euros to the dollar, a $38 breakfast buffet is pretty pricey. When we visited in June 2007 there was still not a single sign on the building, the staff claims this is being resolved but it was very odd. It is located very near large buildings for AlItalia and Toyota so those need to be your landmarks driving to it. One thing that I did see driving in the general area at 6AM on Sunday (headed to the airport) was the pack of dogs that another reviewer noted. They were not on the hotel's property nor are they the hotel's responsibility but I would never suggest someone plan to jog or walk in early morning or evening in this area. I'm a physically fit adult male and even inside a car I was very alarmed by the number of dogs (more than 20). I can't imagine running into them on foot, alone. You need to recognize this hotel is not in the suburbs of Chicago or Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely on the inside but in the middle of nowhere”
Reviews.Author: ShanaLyns
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 10 days at The Rome Marriott Park Hotel for a corporate event. 7 of the days were working days and 3 in the middle were personal days, so I'll evaluate the hotel twice in this review. For business travel, the Rome Marriott Park is a good choice as long as your business does not take you into Rome and your boss is not price-sensitive. The hotel has reasonably fast wi-fi access in the lobby and wired connections in the room. The internet access is very expensive --$22 Euros a day. The rooms themselves are very nice. Marriott has really upgraded their linens and bedding over the last few years and this property totally benefited. On the downside, the hotel feels like it's not fully finished yet. Only one of the two restaurants was open. The menu was limited (5-6 entrees) and quite expensive ($70 US for an appetizer, entree, 1 drink and bread). Room Service's menu had alot of overlap with the dining room menu. The restaurant thing is important because you're a good 20 Euro taxi ride each way from Rome proper unless you can manage to catch the shuttle bus which runs every 2 hours and fills up very quickly. For pleasure travelers, this is really not the hotel to stay at in Rome. You're far from the city in an office park. It is not scenic and it's expensive to get back into Rome. This hotel is really geared towards business travelers. You'd be better off for less somewhere else. The rooms themselves are nice, but the location is horrible for sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Isolated Location”
Reviews.Author: dennytara
Reviews.Content: New Hotel far from center of Rome. Service and rooms up to Marriott standards as a convention hotel. The hotel appeared to be very much empty during our stay so attentive service was not surprising. Our major complaint was lack of wheelchair accessible transport to/from Rome. The free shuttle was a typical full size tour bus not able to accomodate someone in a wheelchair. The staff said our only option was a cab ($35-$45 euros each way). They could not subsidize this option. The food was fine and served in pleasent surroundings but was pricey even by Rome standards. There were no other dining options near the hotel. On our next trip to Rome we will NOT stay here.

Reviews.Title: “nic hotel wrong location”
Reviews.Author: jenfis1
Reviews.Content: I Stayed at this hotel while away on a works seminar. this hotel is very nice and clean and the staff are friendly. I can only describe this hotel as being built on an industrial estate. you did have to get the shuttle bus to and from rome which took about 30mins again if you didn't book the shuttle it became a very costly having to take taxi's to and from rome vary in price from 30 Euros up to 45Euro. I also felt that the the bar was very pricely too. My only one complaint and i suppose i will have to get used to this when travelling is that you couldn't buy cigarettes anywhere in the hotel and there were no surrounding shops to buy anything you would have thought at least there would have been a vending machine somewhere within the hotel. If you were thinking of travelling to Rome i suggest you stay in either of the other two marriot hotels which are located in the city of Rome that way you have more money to spend on food and wine rather than taxi's !!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Sewcr8zy
Reviews.Content: Very disappointing after staying at the Marriott in Paris on the Champs de Elysee! This hotel is too far from everything. A cab costs at least 20 euros or more depending on traffic! The shuttle is ok, but you have to time it based on their schedule and it only drops and picks up at the Piazza Cavour, where there is not much around that is open late at nite. They also charged 15 euros a day to use the spa which wasn't even open at nite!! There are no restaurants around the hotel so you are basically stuck with their outrageous prices for their meals at the Marriott restaurant!!

HotelInfo.Name: Rome Marriott Park Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Colonnello Tommaso Masala 54, 00148 Rome, Italy
